Skin & localized to injection site symptom reports

Male, 26 - 39 years

Age Reported Symptoms Notes
26 2021-01-01 rash, itchy skin Starting 2-3 days after the day I got the Pfizer vaccine, I had itchiness on my upper chest as well ... Read more
Close
Starting 2-3 days after the day I got the Pfizer vaccine, I had itchiness on my upper chest as well as my neck and upper back. On December, 26th, I looked in a mirror and realized I had red dots on my upper chest, upper back, and neck. Over the next two days (the 27th and 28th) the red dots extended to my stomach, lower back, and shoulders. Up until today, the dots have extended to my upper arms, forearms, hands, and legs. I went to employee health to speak to two nurses who agreed I should report this as a potential allergy to Pfizer's vaccine. I am nervous about taking the second dose but am planning on doing so. I have taken Benadryl and applied hydrocortisone cream on the affected areas. I have a medrol dose pack prescription that I will fill if my symptoms get worse. I do not have trouble breathing, but I am constantly itchy each day.
26 2021-01-02 injection site pain Temperature 100.7 temporal, fevers chills, mild injection site tenderness.
26 2021-01-03 hives 8 days after vaccination, i began to have hives over most of my body, starting 8:00am on 1/2/2021. O... Read more
Close
8 days after vaccination, i began to have hives over most of my body, starting 8:00am on 1/2/2021. On 1/3/2021, i went to a walk in and was prescribed prednisone which seemed to make it go away pretty quickly.
26 2021-01-03 hives Systemic Hives, Evaluated in Urgent Care and was provided and recommended Benadryl
26 2021-01-03 hives Systemic Hives, evaluated in Urgent Care and used Benadryl
26 2021-01-04 vaccination site pain Fever; chills; headache; fatigue; injection site pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactab... Read more
Close
Fever; chills; headache; fatigue; injection site pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient). A 26-year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, lot/batch number and expiration date not available), intramuscularly on 23Dec2020 at 12:15 PM on Left arm at single dose for COVID-19 immunization in hospital. The patient medical history included asthma and previously COVID+, prior to vaccination, patient was diagnosed with COVID-19. No known allergy, no allergies to medications, food, or other products. Concomitant medications included salbutamol (ALBUTEROL), montelukast and loratadine. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient experienced fever, chills, headache, fatigue, injection site pain; lasted approximately 24 hours on 24Dec2020 at 12:00 AM. Since the vaccination, patient had not been tested for COVID-19. Therapeutic measures were taken as result of the events included Ibuprofen. The outcome of the events was recovered in Dec2020. The report was reported as non-serious, with seriousness criteria-Results in death: No; Life threatening: No; Caused/prolonged hospitalization: No; Disabling/Incapacitating: No; Congenital anomaly/birth defect: No. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.
26 2021-01-04 rash, hives Lips swelled and went numb. Hands swelled and went numb. Rash/redness covering upper body. Hives on ... Read more
Close
Lips swelled and went numb. Hands swelled and went numb. Rash/redness covering upper body. Hives on arms. Nasal passages clogged
26 2021-01-05 hives, itchy skin 2 days after receiving vaccine patient developed hives and itching. Treated with OTC diphenhydramine... Read more
Close
2 days after receiving vaccine patient developed hives and itching. Treated with OTC diphenhydramine.
26 2021-01-07 vaccination site pain Injection site muscle soreness/pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable pharmacist (pat... Read more
Close
Injection site muscle soreness/pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable pharmacist (patient himself). This 26-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number EL0142), via an unknown route, on 05Jan2021 at 17:30 at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Age at vaccination was 26-year-old. Vaccine location was left arm. The patient did not have a relevant medical history. No known allergies. No relevant concomitant medications were provided. No other vaccine was received in four weeks. Pre-vaccination and post-vaccination COVID tests were not performed. On 06Jan2021 at 08:00, the patient developed injection site muscle soreness/pain. The patient was not treated for the event. The patient was recovering from the event. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Close
Fever-like symptoms for 24 hours - beginning 24 hours after vaccination. Temperature 99.3 24 hours after vaccination, body aches, fatigue. Soreness at vaccination route for 72 hours.
26 2021-01-12 vaccination site pain Fever; Injection site pain; tiredness; chills; feeling unwell; This is a spontaneous report from a c... Read more
Close
Fever; Injection site pain; tiredness; chills; feeling unwell; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Other HCP (patient). A 26-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot EH9899), via Intramuscular on 06Jan2021 08:00 at single dose in the left arm for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included Asthma. Concomitant medications were not reported. On 06Jan2021, the patient experienced fever, injection site pain, tiredness, chills, feeling unwell. The patient did not receive any treatment. Outcome of events was recovered on Jan2021. No follow up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.
26 2021-01-13 itchy skin, rash papular, redness Pt. states he received vaccine at 1450 and started feeling symptoms at 1505. States itchy sensation... Read more
Close
Pt. states he received vaccine at 1450 and started feeling symptoms at 1505. States itchy sensation, no hives on back, neck, left arm, left leg, down to foot. No rash/hives. At apprx. 1515 144/73, afebrile, 76, 99% on room air. At 1525 bp 134/80, HR 70, 98% room air. Presents only 1 raised red area behind right ear. Employee Health RN assessed skin and no rash, irritation, hives, or redness present. Pt. was ok to return to work after receiving 125 mg of oral diphenhydramine.
26 2021-01-18 injection site pain Slight chills and some body aches, mild headache, all starting at night. Sore arm at injection site ... Read more
Close
Slight chills and some body aches, mild headache, all starting at night. Sore arm at injection site reaction. Vaccine was administered around 10am. Went to sleep and woke up with more severe headache, took Naprosyn, headache resolved. Chills and body aches were gone after sleeping. Some fatigue also present after waking up.
26 2021-01-20 hives Allergic reaction resulting in full body hives, swollen hands, eyelids and lips; Allergic reaction r... Read more
Close
Allergic reaction resulting in full body hives, swollen hands, eyelids and lips; Allergic reaction resulting in full body hives, swollen hands, eyelids and lips; Allergic reaction resulting in full body hives, swollen hands, eyelids and lips; Allergic reaction resulting in full body hives, swollen hands, eyelids and lips; Allergic reaction resulting in full body hives, swollen hands, eyelids and lips; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other health professional (patient). A 27-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, lot number and expiry date were unknown) at the age of 26 years old, via intramuscular route in the left arm, on 10Jan2021 at 13:00, at a single dose, for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included high blood pressure. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient has no known allergies. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID prior vaccination. The patient did not receive other vaccines within four weeks prior to COVID vaccination. The vaccine was administered in the hospital. On 12Jan2021, at 07:30 A.M., the patient experienced allergic reaction resulting in full body hives, swollen hands, eyelids and lips. The patient did not receive treatment for the events. Outcome of the events was recovering. The patient has not been tested for COVID-19 since vaccination. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.
26 2021-01-21 hives Hives Throughout body and scalp
26 2021-01-25 vaccination site pain Sore arm at injection site; cold sore; Sore throat; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contacta... Read more
Close
Sore arm at injection site; cold sore; Sore throat; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable Pharmacist(patient). The 26-year-old male patient received first dose BNT162B2(Covid 19, lot EK5730), via an unspecified route of administration at left arm on 28Dec2020 17:15 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization in hospital. Medical history included last cold sore was over 2 years ago. There was no other vaccine in four weeks. There was no known allergies, no other medical history. There were no concomitant medications. The patient experienced sore throat occurred 2 days after vaccination(30Dec2020), sore arm at injection site, cold sore appearance 8 days after vaccination, both on 05Jan2021. There was no treatment. There was no covid prior vaccination, covid tested post vaccination was Nasal Swab with PCR on 08Jan2021 with negative result. Outcome of events was recovered in Jan2021 . No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.
26 2021-02-01 vaccination site pain Bilateral painful and enlarged cervical, supra-clavicular, and axillary lymph nodes - Onset: 12 hour... Read more
Close
Bilateral painful and enlarged cervical, supra-clavicular, and axillary lymph nodes - Onset: 12 hours post-vaccination Duration: >40 hours; Bilateral painful and enlarged cervical, supra-clavicular, and axillary lymph nodes - Onset: 12 hours post-vaccination Duration: >40 hours; Fever - Onset: 6 hours post-vaccination Duration: >40 hours; Generalized muscle soreness - Onset: 6 hours post-vaccination Duration - 30 hours; Headache - Onset: 6 hours post-vaccination Duration: >40 hours; Tiredness - Onset: 4 hours post-vaccination Duration: >40 hours; Injection site soreness - Onset: 2 hours post-vaccination; Start Date/Time:17Jan2021 03:00 PM; Start Date/Time: 31Dec2020 01:00 PM; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable healthcare professional (patient). A 26-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, lot number: EL3247), via an unspecified route of administration on left arm on 17Jan2021 15:00 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. There were no medical history and concomitant medications. The patient had no known allergies. No other vaccine in four weeks. No other medications in two weeks. No COVID prior vaccination. The patient previously took first dose of BNT162B2 (lot number: EL0142) on 31Dec2020 13:00 on left arm for COVID-19 immunization. On 17Jan2021, 2 hours post-vaccination (17:00) patient had injection site soreness; 4 hours post vaccination patient had tiredness for more than 40 hours; and 6 hours post vaccination (21:00) patient had fever for more than more than 40 hours, generalized muscle soreness for 30 hours, and headache for 40 hours. On 18Jan2021, 12 hours post vaccination (03:00), patient had bilateral painful and enlarged cervical, supra-clavicular, and axillary lymph nodes for more than 40 hours. There was no treatment for the events. Patient was not COVID tested post vaccination. The outcome of the events was recovering. No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.
26 2021-02-01 itchy rash, rash Patient experienced flu like symptoms the morning after receiving his vaccine (1/29). Symptoms impr... Read more
Close
Patient experienced flu like symptoms the morning after receiving his vaccine (1/29). Symptoms improved by 1/31). On 2/1, patient woke up with a rash all over his body that was pruritic. Patient took Benadryl which helped improve his symptoms. Today (2/2), patient woke up with angioedema. He took another Benadryl--symptoms improved. Denies SOB, tongue swelling, itchy throat, or wheezing. Swelling is localized to lips only.
26 2021-02-03 vaccination site pain Fever; Chills; Headache; Muscle aches; Injection site burning and soreness for 36 hours; This is a s... Read more
Close
Fever; Chills; Headache; Muscle aches; Injection site burning and soreness for 36 hours; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional (the patient). A 26-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, lot number EL9262), intramuscular in the left arm on 20Jan2021 10:30 (at the age of 26-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included asthma, and the patient was diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. The patient did not have any allergies to medications, food, or other products. The patient did not have any concomitant medications. The patient had not received any other vaccine within 4 weeks prior to the vaccine. On 21Jan2021, the patient experienced fever, chills, headache, muscle aches, injection site burning and soreness for 36 hours (as reported). The patient did not receive treatment for these events. The clinical outcome of fever, chills, headache, muscle aches, injection site burning and soreness was recovering (as reported). It was also reported that since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected

Having fatigue, chills, alopecia, arthralgias, N/V, diarrhea, intermittent rhinorrhea and nasal congestion, lower back pain, neck pain for the last 2 weeks
26 2021-03-01 vaccination site pain fatigue; arm soreness; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer (patient). ... Read more
Close
fatigue; arm soreness; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer (patient). A 26-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, lot number: EL3247, expiry date was unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on right arm on 03Feb2021 11:30 AM at single dose for COVID-19 immunization, at workplace clinic. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19, prior to vaccination. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. On 03Feb2021, 18:00, the patient experienced fatigue, arm soreness. Patient was not given treatment for the events. The events were assessed as non-serious by the reporter. The outcome of the events was reported as recovering. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.
26 2021-03-03 rash Rash (red spots, not raised, not itchy) all over abdomen, stomach, a bit on arms, and some on thighs... Read more
Close
Rash (red spots, not raised, not itchy) all over abdomen, stomach, a bit on arms, and some on thighs. This rash appeared within a week or so of getting the first dose of the Pfizer COVID vaccine. Over the next few weeks the rash slowly faded (not completely, though). When I woke up the morning after receiving the second dose of the vaccine, the rash doubled in coverage in the same areas of my body. Around the time the rash showed up, I also began experiencing lower to mid-back pain, which grew more severe over time. The back pain is worst in the morning after sleeping, or after sitting/resting for longer periods of time. I've been taking Ibuprofen and Aleve, which helps, as does being active. The back pain did not noticeably worsen after the second dose, but it is just as severe. Currently, the rash has faded (not completely), and my back pain is still quite bothersome.
26 2021-03-10 rash, itchy rash pt reported by phone that he was having itching and rash on forearms and torsu.
26 2021-03-11 bruising Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Systemic: Hypotens... Read more
Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Systemic: Hypotension-Mild, Additional Details: Patient fainted, unfortunately did fall, however despite some bruises was ok. Waited for family to come to get him and was able to leave under his own power. Ambulance was called and he was checked, no issues found and did not leave with ambulance.
26 2021-03-15 itchy rash, redness, rash Two days after second shot Patient experienced: tingling/numbness in both hands; A rash to his face,... Read more
Close
Two days after second shot Patient experienced: tingling/numbness in both hands; A rash to his face,chin and to both arms; Itching with bumps, swollen fingers and toes; Rash and swelling moves around body with elevated joint/bone pain; fevers on/off. 2/13/21- Went to Urgent Care, given Keflex with no change.2/15/21- Urgent Care second visit, Keflex stopped.2/17/21- Clinic, Benadryl & Tylenol PRN and labs done with no change in rash, Covid test negative. 2/18/21- Dermatology Appointment- Doxycycline 100mg BID, Hydroxyzine PRN, Zyrtec OT, Punchbx left ankle. 3/11/21 - No diagnosis made in Hospital or from follow-up visit with Dermatologist. Continue to have occasional area of transient redness and some numbness and tingling in hands.

26 2021-03-22 rash Symptoms showed up as swollen lymph nodes on left side of neck and head (around ear) with swollen bu... Read more
Close
Symptoms showed up as swollen lymph nodes on left side of neck and head (around ear) with swollen bumps running up the back of the scalp. These large bumps eventually split into a painful rash and scabbed over.
26 2021-03-24 vaccination site pain Significant soreness at injection site; Headache; tiredness; feeling as if in a bubble day of vaccin... Read more
Close
Significant soreness at injection site; Headache; tiredness; feeling as if in a bubble day of vaccine; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 26-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: EL9266) via an unspecified route of administration in the right arm on 21Feb2021 at 13:45 (at the age of 26-years-old) as a single dose, for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included asthma, weakened immune system, and allergy to loratadine (CLARITIN). Prior to vaccination the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Concomitant medications included salbutamol (ALBUTEROL) as needed and fluticasone propionate/ salmeterol xinafoate (ADVAIR 500/50). On 21Feb2021 at 14:15, the patient experienced headache, tiredness and was feeling as if in a bubble the day of vaccine. The next day, on 22Feb2021, the patient experienced significant soreness at injection site. The patient was not treated for headache, tiredness, feeling as if in a bubble the day of vaccine, and significant soreness at injection site. The clinical outcome of headache, tiredness, feeling as if in a bubble the day of vaccine, and significant soreness at injection site was recovering.

Close
?Covid arm? Red bumps appeared around spot where vaccine was injected approx 48 hours after dose 1. Itchy. Also had tough time sleeping which is rare for me. Maybe related.
26 2021-04-18 skin spots Thrombocytopenia with Platelet count of 2 with development of petechial rash and spontaneous bleedin... Read more
Close
Thrombocytopenia with Platelet count of 2 with development of petechial rash and spontaneous bleeding from gums noted 3 days after immunization. Patient was evaluated in the Emergency Room and admitted to the hospital requiring IVIG infusion and IV steroids with slow up-trend in platelet count over 4 days of hospitalization prior to discharge with Platelet count of 49.
26 2021-04-27 injection site pain Long term muscle fatigue/pain. Primarily noticed when doing chest exercises in the gym (I.e. barbell... Read more
Close
Long term muscle fatigue/pain. Primarily noticed when doing chest exercises in the gym (I.e. barbell flat bench). Largely only a problem during flat bench, no issues with incline dumbbell press. Pain/soreness is isolated to the medial deltoid where the injection occurred, and only in the left arm where the injection occurred. Only began after dose 2. Noticed the week following the dose, pain persists. No treatment action taken.
26 2021-05-07 vaccination site pain within fraction of seconds I fell down (lost conscious); After sometime i woke up I barely could see... Read more
Close
within fraction of seconds I fell down (lost conscious); After sometime i woke up I barely could see; On the same night, my left arm (where shot is injected) started paining; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 26-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 20Apr2021 17:45, at the age of 26 years old, (Batch/Lot Number: EW0170) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was not reported. There were no concomitant medications. The patient previously took Tetanus shot and after 5-10 mins of it he lost conscious for a while. The patient experienced lost conscious on 22Apr2021 07:45 with outcome of recovered, vaccination site pain on 20Apr2021 with outcome of recovered, vision blurred on 22Apr2021 with outcome of recovered. The clinical course was as follows on the same night of vaccination the left arm (where shot is injected) started pain and became pain relief after a day i.e., 21Apr2021. The next day on 22Apr2021 he woke up and went to bathroom for his daily routines. He stepped in shower and stood under water for sometime then he removed the band-aid from the left arm (where the shot is given) within fraction of seconds he fell down (lost conscious) on the left hand side from the bath tub (him legs still in the bath tub) after sometime he woke up and now fell in the bath tub. After sometime he woke up, and he barely could see, tied him towel and came out to him room and laid down for a while. Then everything went back to normal. The patient didn't receive treatment for the events.

Close
Fever as high as 101.6, body aches, severe pain at injection site, convulsions/chills, nausea, cough, migraine

Nausea and drowsiness began 2.5 hours post injection, resolved 9 hours post injection. Sore and tender injection site (left arm), began 30 minutes post injection. Has improved, but still slightly tender 49 hours post injection.

Close
Approximately 57 hours after receiving 2nd dose of Pfizer vaccine, I developed hive patches throughout my body. I took 50 mg Benadryl and went to bed. Work up the next morning to observe some res spots, but minimal itching. I reported to work, where I am an EMT for an ambulance service. During shift, at approximately 1500 hours, I had a patient who was cold, so I cranked up the heat in the back of the ambulance. I started to sweat. My hive then came back with a vengeance all over my body. I immediately took 50 mg Benadryl and went to the urgent care center. The doctor told me to continue with the Benadryl and to pick up a prescription of Prednisone if symptoms worsen. Symptoms where mostly cleared up at that point. I got off shift at 1900. Hive worsened at approximately 2000. I picked up the prednisone and intend to begin taking it in the morning if symptoms are not much improved.

27 2021-03-11 itchy skin Pt. was vaccinated by another pharmacist at our remote clinic at an elementary school at 11:35am 3/1... Read more
Close
Pt. was vaccinated by another pharmacist at our remote clinic at an elementary school at 11:35am 3/11/21. Within less than 3 minutes the patient informed a student that he did not feel well. He reported: itching, feeling hot, shortness of breath, dizziness, loss of vision, and thirst. The student alerted me and I assessed the pt. He was responsive, but felt "tired". He was sitting on the floor. I told the student to call 911. I continued talking with the pt. as I was preparing the epinephrine and placing a blood pressure cuff on his arm. He became less responsive and asked me for the epinephrine. I injected him with an EpiPen 0.3mg in his outer left thigh through his pants (at 11:43am). Within approximately 30s-1min the pt. became more responsive. I then took his pulse and BP shortly before EMS arrived (11:52am) . They performed the second blood pressure reading and the pt. was transferred to their care at that point.

Treatment at clinic: Oxygen mask was put on to 4 litters, breathing treatment done, Benadryl, Pepcid, Tylenol, and then eppy shot was given. Ambulance then came to clinic and took my son to the ER. Most of the same thing was done in the ER. Patient still felt bad after 4 or 5 hrs in ER room. So he was admitted to stay in the hospital. He stayed 3 days and 2 nights in the hospital. He had breathing issues, nausea, headaches, and Elevated heart rate for the first 2 days. Wasn?t till the 3 day that he felt well enough to go home.

This 28 year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, lot number: EL1284 ), dose 1 , single dose via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 06Jan2021 at 12:00 PM (at the age of 28 years-old) for COVID-19 vaccination. Headache; Low grade fever; Nausea; Diarrhea; Sore injection site; Dose 1 administration date:21Jan2021/ Dose 2 administration date:04Feb2021.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 28-year-old male patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, lot: EL3248), via an unspecified route of administration on right arm on 04Feb2021 at 14:00 (at the age of 28years) at single dose for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included asthma. Concomitant medications included cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC) and an unspecified multivitamin which were received within 2 weeks. Historical vaccine included first dose of bnt162b2 (lot: EL3248) on left arm on 21Jan2021 at 16:30 (at the age of 28years) for COVID-19 immunization. On 05Feb2021 at 12:00, the patient experienced headache, low grade fever, nausea, diarrhea, and sore injection site. No treatment was received for the adverse event. The events were considered by the patient as non-serious as did not results in death, non-life threatening, did not cause/prolong hospitalization, non-disabling/incapacitating and no Congenital anomaly/birth defect. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The facility where the most recent COVID-19 vaccine was administered at the workplace clinic. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the events headache, pyrexia, nausea, diarrhoea and vaccination site pain was recovered in Feb2021.

28 2021-03-18 vaccination site pain migraine; Fever; mild chills/uncontrollable heavy shivering; cold sweats; Mild muscle pain at inject... Read more
Close
migraine; Fever; mild chills/uncontrollable heavy shivering; cold sweats; Mild muscle pain at injection site; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional (the patient). A 28-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number EN5318), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 14Feb2021 07:30 (at the age of 28-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history included: ADHD (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder), severe migraine, unknown vestibular event in June-Jul2020 attributed to vestibular migraines based on normal CT, MRI, and EEG. The patient had no known allergies. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Concomitant medications included: amfetamine aspartate/ amfetamine sulfate/ dexamfetamine saccharate/ dexamfetamine sulfate (ADDERALL), amitriptyline, caffeine/ paracetamol (EXCEDRIN), all taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number EL4262), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 26Jan2021 16:00 (at the age of 28-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. On 14Feb2021, the patient experienced mild muscle pain at injection site onset 1 hour after injection (at 08:30) lasted about 24 hours. At 01:20 on 15Feb2021, also reported as 17 hours 10 minutes post-injection, the patient woke up with mild chills, temperature (oral thermometer) was 97.6°F. Chills and cold sweats progressed rapidly, with severe chills and uncontrollable heavy shivering and sweating present within 10-15 minutes (on 15Feb2021). Temperature at 02:00 15Feb2021 was 103.0°F. Fever slowly waned without medication. By 04:30, fever at 101.2°F, chills mild, sweating persisted. At 07:00 15Feb2021, the patient started to develop early stages of migraine (preexisting condition), took EXCEDRIN 565 mg tablet x 2. At 08:00 15Feb2021, the temperature was 98.2°F. By 10:00 15Feb2021, the fever resolved, temperature 97.6 (individual baseline) and chills had resolved. Sweating has improved to be more mild, but persistent now at 16:30 15Feb2021. Treatment was received for migraine. No treatment was received for the other events. The clinical outcome of mild muscle pain at injection site was recovered on 15Feb2021 08:30, chills and fever both recovered on 15Feb2021 10:00. The clinical outcome of cold sweats and migraine was recovering. It was also reported that since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19.

. Pfizer dose 1 on 3/30. Just had sore arm. Symptoms dizziness began on 4/3. Otherwise feeling well. Labs drawn 4/5 which revealed pancytopenia, rechecked today and numbers are worsening. Working to get him into hematology now. 28 yo male s/p Covid-19 Vaccine (Pfizer) on 3/30 with lightheadedness only when bending down and coming up returns for follow up today for pancytopenia found on labs obtained 4/5. He denies any recent viral symptoms. He did not have any episodes in past that made him question that he may have had Covid-19 viral illness. He is able to tolerate his normal daily exercise and bike without any symptoms. He has no dietary restrictions, eats dairy, meat, lots of vegetables/fruits, pastas and some breads/cereals. He drinks alcohol once per week. He abstains from ETOH every April. He has used edible THC in past, only once per month at most. He has not been tested for HIV in past. His girlfriend, in last semester of school advised him to ask about HIV testing. He denies any chest pain, SOB, HA. Upon review of his lab results yesterday, I called the hematology fellow, Dr. through program at hospital and he recommended the labs to be obtained and rechecking labs in one week. He felt the student was not exhibiting any emergent symptoms requiring emergent evaluation. Patient and I spoke on phone after this call with fell at 1557 4/6 and I advised him to seek emergent medical eval in ED for any CP, SOB, HA or any neurologic symptoms. Patient has not had any of those symptoms. He exercised this morning without difficulty. He notes raised papules on legs which he has had in past. They have currently been present for a few days. He believes it to be related to biking in sweatpants. He has been in a hot tub recently, but after the bumps were present. They do not itch. He has had them in past, more in winter months with heavier clothing. He also notices slight left arm pain today. This was site of his vaccine. He denies any swollen lymph nodes. He is notices only with arm movement. He denies any FH of blood disorder/ blood cancers/MDS. He denies bruising, bleeding or dark stools. He states he likely has not had a blood draw in past, unless one visit to ER, for HA/concussion in high school (9+yrs ago) resulted in any blood test.
28 2021-04-17 hives, itchy skin, redness, itchy rash, vaccination site itchiness Blurred vision; Face and skin are red; Lips tingling; feeling slightly itchy at the injection site a... Read more
Close
Blurred vision; Face and skin are red; Lips tingling; feeling slightly itchy at the injection site after the vaccine/Itching all over his head, scalp, arms and hands, everything; Hives; Tongue and lip swelling/Tongue was starting to swell; Tongue and lip swelling; Shortness of breath; Tachycardia; Anaphylactic shock/anaphylactic reaction; Still has a rash and is itchy/break out rash and get itchy again; Not really wanting to eat dinner; I got home my arm had swollen/Whole arm and hand were swollen; I started feeling slightly itchy at the injection site after the vaccine; Nausea; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumers and other Health Professional. This is a report combining information from duplicate reports 2021372891 and 2021368246. The current and all subsequent information will be reported under manufacturer report number 2021368246. A 28-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection; lot number : EP7533), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in Arm Left on 02Apr2021 11:30 (Batch/Lot Number: EP7533) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included Sleep Apnea ongoing; idiopathic hypersomnia ongoing; High blood pressure (They want to treat her husband for high blood pressure but they don't want to do that until after these reactions. She clarifies he was having issues with high blood pressure prior to getting the vaccine); Little overweight. Concomitant medication included amfetamine aspartate, amfetamine sulfate, dexamfetamine saccharate, dexamfetamine sulfate (ADDERALL) from 2020 and ongoing 20 mg, 1x/day; modafinil from 2019 ongoing 200 mg, 1x/day for Idiopathic hyposomnia for Sleep apnea. patient got the first dose of the vaccine on Friday and within 30 minutes, went into anaphylactic shock and was taken to the local emergency room after being administered Benadryl and an EpiPen without any kind of changes. He was discharged and then on Sunday night, he went into anaphylactic shock again and was taken back to the ER after once again being administered Benadryl and an EpiPen. Now, he was kind of starting to break out in a rash again. This has thrown them for a loop because most of the time they had heard that more severe reactions come with the second dose. She confirms this was her husband first dose. Her husband had sat at Pharmacy for the required 15 minutes and he was feeling a little itchy around the vaccine site. It was just around the site, so they left. In the 10 minutes to get home, he started itching all over his head, scalp, arms and hands, everything (02Apr2021). they looked at his site and his entire arm was starting to swell and there was a rash that had gone all the way down his arm. her husband whole arm and hand were swollen and his tongue was starting to swell. He was administered liquid Benadryl and the Epi shot, He was brought to the emergency room at the hospital. He went home after going to the ER. Her husband had another anaphylactic reaction last night. He hasn't had any new foods or exposure to anything. states that they did say it was possible to have a relapse but that it was rare. He had presented slightly differently but kind of similar. It started with him feeling nauseated and not really wanting to eat dinner. He went upstairs to shower and he started to get itchy again. So, she administered 50ml of liquid Benadryl to just get it into his system and then about 10 minutes later, it was not really having any effect and his tongue and stuff started tingling. She looked at his tongue and his tongue was starting to swell again. So, that's when she administered the EpiPen and 911 was called. Her husband was brought to the Emergency room again and was discharged a few hours later. They didn't keep him overnight for observation or anything. states he is still experiencing blurred vision, red skin, and chest is still red a little bit at the top, and his face is red. His lips are started to tingle but was not interfering with his breathing yet, shortness of breath, tachycardia 02Apr2021. Caller states that about 1 hour ago, patient took one tablet of Benadryl and was given 20ml liquid Benadryl 15 minutes ago. Tests: X-ray was clear (Negative), blood work came back normal. She just feels like its getting to the point where everything is just being prolonged. When they went to the ER, he was been on Benadryl, EpiPens, they provided him steroids, Oxygen, Prednisone, Pepcid to try and prolong the effects of the Benadryl and it doesn't seem like anything is working. patient started feeling slightly itchy at the injection site after the vaccine. I waited the 15 minutes after the injection without having any serious side effects. By the time I got home, my arm had swollen and developed hives 02Apr2021. received Benadryl and an Epi pen. By that time, the rash and hives had spread throughout my body, and my arm, hand, and tongue had swollen. was having trouble breathing and was taken to the ER. On Sunday evening, had a relapse and it started with nausea. Within 30 minutes, was itchy and my tongue started swelling. Patient had Blurred vision; Face and skin are red; Lips tingling; Not really wanting to eat dinner on 05Apr2021; the patient not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine; List of any other medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination: Adderall; Prior to vaccination, the patient diagnosed with COVID-19 was Unknown; Since the vaccination, the patient not tested for COVID19, The patient received treatment for all events except events blurred vision; face and skin are red; tingling lips; appetite lost. The outcome of the events blurred vision; face and skin are red; tingling lips; appetite lost was unknown; rest of the events was not recovered.

seizures/Convulsions; weird metal or acidic taste in my mouth; felt heavy; feel shaky; back spasms; blood pressure spiked to higher than normal levels; nauseous; weakness on my left side; pain at the injection site; pain at the injection site, my back, and neck; pain at the injection site, my back, and neck; feel super tired; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 28-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm left on 06Apr2021 11:15 (Batch/Lot Number: EP7533) as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included axenfeld reigers, bilateral congenital iris coloboma, bilateral glaucoma, hearing loss. Known allergies: peanut, albuterol, amoxicillin-pot clavulante, doxycycline, fentanyl, levosalbutamol (LEVALBUTEROL), oxycodone-acetaminophin, sedation. Concomitant medications in two weeks: cryofood (unspecific), folic acid, cyanocobalamin (B12), timolol and dorzolamide hydrochloride/timolol, all from unknown date for unknown indication. First, patient had a weird metal or acidic taste in mouth. Following that, patient felt heavy. Next, began to feel shaky having back spasms. His blood pressure spiked to higher than normal levels and started feeling shakey dropped. Patient was laid down by nursing staff and blood pressure dropped. After being laid down, patient started having seizures/convulsions, paramedics were called and patient was given midazolam hydrochloride (VERSED, anti-seizure meds) and was taken to the ER (emergency room). Once patient arrived at the ER, he felt nauseous and was given anti-nausea medication, after about 4 hours patient was released. But he was experiencing weakness on left side and pain at the injection site, back, and neck, and felt super tired. AEs onset at 11:30 of 06Apr2021. Outcome of the events was resolving. Patient had no COVID prior vaccination and had no COVID tested post vaccination.

afraid to take second dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine due to the events; brain fog every single day; kind of off and uneasy; body aches; slight dizziness not like he was going to fall over, but cant stand still without lean a little/felt immediate rush to the head and feeling of fainting; very weird like an out of body experience this was almost like an anxiety attack/anxiety attacks for every 30 minutes or so; tension headaches; Chills; tunnel vision/tunneled, it was like tunnel vision and a very very weird like an out of body experience this was almost like an anxiety attack; it was extremely intense; pain at the injection; insane rush from the bottom of his feet to the top of head, felt like he was going to pass out; weakness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (Patient). A 28-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer COVID Vaccine, solution for injection, Lot Number: ER8733; Expiration Date: 31Jul2021), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 28Mar2021 at 17:00 (at the age of 28 years-old) as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included ongoing asthma, anxiety experienced years and years ago when he was about 19-20 years old and it has been under control, he hasn't had this happen in years. The patient mother suffers from slight anxiety at times; dad currently has high blood pressure. Concomitant medication included albuterol sulfate taken for asthma (in inhalation (90mcg per actuation 200 metered inhalations: 2 puffs as needed) and liquid form (0.083% 2.5 mg out of 3ml as needed) for nebulizer since he was born). Patient did not have COVID prior vaccination. Patient did not want to contract COVID-19 because he has asthma. On 28Mar2021 at 17:00 (within 5 minutes of vaccination), patient experienced Tunnel Vision, chills, weakness, insane rush from the bottom of his feet to the top of head, felt like he was going to pass out (which was recovered same day with lasting effects), weakness, hasn't felt the same; feels like something is off every day; not himself, very weird like an out of body experience this was almost like an anxiety attack/anxiety attacks for every 30 minutes or so, tension headaches, dizziness and felt immediate rush to the head and feeling of fainting, at 8PM or 9PM, he felt pain at the injection and body aches. The patient visited physician room as a result of Insane tension headaches, and anxiety. On 29Mar2021, he didn't really feel too anxious, but he felt out of place, kind of off and uneasy. The chills and body aches, kind of off and uneasy were disappeared on 30Mar2021. On 31Mar2021, brain fog and slight dizziness does not like he was going to fall over but cant stand still without lean a little/felt immediate rush to the head and feeling of fainting. On 02Apr2021, injection site pain was gradually faded away. The patient states that these events started after the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of events included Tylenol. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included SARS-CoV-2 test (Nasal swab): Pending on 06Apr2021. The patient did not take any other vaccinations four weeks prior to vaccination. The patient was afraid to take second dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine due to the events. Patient felt very hard to work with these symptoms and to get through everyday life, it is very tough. Patient knows plenty of people that died from COVID-19 and he does not want to have to make changes and fix things in his life that he did not cause and worries this will stick around for the rest of his life all because he took a vaccine. The patient had physician office and Emergency room visit. The outcome of the events insane rush from the bottom of his feet to the top of head, felt like he was going to pass out, pain at the injection, chills and body aches were recovered, while for tension headaches, anxiety attacks, dizziness, weakness, brain fog, hasn't felt the same; feels like something is off every day; not himself was not recovered, and for tunnel vision it was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

However, there was no rash or discoloration from what I could tell. Two weeks after the injection my scalp felt like it was on fire and the hair started falling out in clumps easily.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Other-HCP (patient). A 29-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (Lot/Batch number and expiry date unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on 18Dec2020 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included High blood pressure and depression, both from unknown date. Concomitant medication included venlafaxine and lamotrigine. On 30Dec2020, the patient lost all the hair at the top of her head. He was already slowly balding/thinning. Two weeks after the injection, his scalp felt like it was on fire and the hair started falling out in clumps easily. The hair has not grown back. The patient did not receive any treatment for the event. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the events was not recovered. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Pt took with water, no difficulty swallowing. 1505 BP 132/95, HR 86, O2 sat 97% on room air. Patient released at 1600 per physician orders. A 29-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, lot number: EK9231; expiry date: unknown) via an unspecified route of administration in the right arm, on 05Jan2021 at 16:00, at a single dose, for COVID-19 immunization. Relevant medical history included known allergies to poison ivy/ poison oak. Concomitant medications included finasteride. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, lot number: EK5730; expiry date: unknown) on 17Dec2020 at 14:00 in the left arm for COVID-19 immunization. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID prior vaccination. The patient did not receive other vaccines within four weeks prior to COVID vaccination. The vaccine was administered in the hospital. On 05Jan2021, at 20:00, after second dose, the patient experienced hives with itching and swelling of feet, hands, axilla, buttocks, redness on hips, worsening after 1 week after second dose. On an unspecified date in Jan2021, for a 3-day period after second dose, patient had fever, chills, fatigue, malaise, body aches, headache, tinnitus, all since resolved except hives worsening. The patient did not receive therapy for the events. Outcome of the event hives was not recovered, for event "administration date: 17Dec2020 / administration date: 05Jan2021" was unknown, while for the other events was recovered. The patient has not been tested for COVID-19 since vaccination.

Heat pad applied to lower the swelling./Left forearm swelling; joint pain; minor muscle and joint pain; Fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 29-year-old male patient received his second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), intramuscularly on right arm on 12Jan2021 at 15:45 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included shellfish allergy. There were no concomitant medications. The patient previously received his first dose of BNT162B2 intramuscularly on left arm on 22Dec2020 at 09:00 AM for COVID-19 immunization, two weeks later a mass grew within the muscle at the forearm region. No ecchymosis with minor pain. Heat pad applied to lower the swelling. After the second shot on unknown date in Jan2021, same type of swelling happened the following day directly at the injection site with minor muscle and joint pain and fatigue. Heat pad applied to lower the swelling. There has been significant relief with just rest and applications of heat to both locations. Left forearm swelling is almost completely gone. The outcome of event vaccination site swelling was recovered on unknown date in Jan2021. The outcome of rest events was unknown. Information on the Lot/Batch number has been requested.

12hr after second dose: increased pain at injection site, but no swelling or redness; headache; Discomfort is a 6/10; gradual onset of soreness raidiating from lymphnodes in neck; gradual onset of soreness in chest/ soreness in bronchi; gradual onset of soreness in back; gradual onset of soreness in hips; gradual onset of soreness in legs; gradual onset of soreness in glutes; soreness in upper lungs; soreness in upper respiratory system; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable consumer. A 29-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number=EL3247), via an unspecified route of administration on the left arm from 18Jan2021 at a SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included major depression, anxiety; increased airway sensitivity due to being former smoker from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. Concomitant medication included vilazodone hydrochloride (VIIBRYD), loratadine (LORATADINE), theanine (THEANINE). The patient previously received the first dose on 28Dec2020 (Lot number=EK3730). There were no noticable effects after the first dose but 12hrs after second dose (19Jan2021), the patient experienced increased pain at injection site, but no swelling or redness. There was gradual onset of soreness raidiating from lymphnodes in neck, chest, back, hips/glutes, and legs; headache; soreness in upper lungs/bronchii (they are hypersensitive and usually sometimes get sore in reaction to irritants in the air), as well as upper respiratory system, but no difficulty breathing. Discomfort was at 6/10 on 19Jan2021. The outcome of the events was not recovered.

The patient medical history was not reported. No allergies to medications, food, or other products. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received 1st dose of BNT162B2 in left arm on 23Jan2021 at 12:30 for COVID-19 immunization. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Beginning approx 11 hours post (14Feb2021 01:00) was chills, aches (spine, occiput, hips, knees, injection site), and fever initially 100.6F. Fever reduced acetaminophen over time. Aches continued. Fever returned at 101.1F by about 5pm day after shot. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included body temperature: 100.6 fahrenheit (fever initially) on 14Feb2021, body temperature: 101.1 fahrenheit by about 5pm day after shot on 14Feb2021. 29 2021-03-14 rash, hives Around 1:00pm received the Pfizer COVID- 19 vaccine at the group home administered by staff. Abou... Read more
Close
Around 1:00pm received the Pfizer COVID- 19 vaccine at the group home administered by staff. About 10 minutes after getting the vaccine begin to develop an allergic reaction on both arms. The staff observed for about 15 more minutes and advised if condition worsens to seek medical attention. The group home administrator was contacted. As a precaution was taken to . While at the Urgent Care more hives developed on his arms, neck and buttock area. He was evaluated by the doctor and two injections were given. Benadryl 50 mg intramuscular and Solu- Medrol 125mg intramuscular. He was observed by the doctor and nurses for 30 minutes after the injections, the reaction improved. was prescribed Benadryl 25mg 1 capsule every 12 hours for 5 days and Prednisone 20mg 3 tablets daily for 4 days. was discharged and is at home in stable condition with close supervision. will follow up with his Primary Care Physician as scheduled. is doing well. Skin has cleared.

30 2021-01-04 itchy skin After vaccination, employee went to the monitoring area. Around 1450, he complained of nausea and t... Read more
Close
After vaccination, employee went to the monitoring area. Around 1450, he complained of nausea and then began to vomit. He then began to c/o flushing, itching, headache, chest tightness, and SOB. Symptoms began approximately 10 min. after immunization. V/S: 126/82; pulse 103; resp 20; O2 sat 99% on RA; pupils equal and reactive. Dr. was notified and assessed the employee. Dr. ordered Benadryl 50mg IM at 1455. This was administed by RN to Left Arm. At 1505, FSBS was 87; O2 sat 98% on RA, pulse 97. At 1510, O2 sat was 98% on RA; pulse 90. At 1520, O2 sat was 98% on RA and pulse 98. Employee continued to vomit. Lungs were clear upon assessment. Skin was pink. At 1528, employee reported that the symptoms were about the same...maybe waxing and waning. Dr. ordered Zofran 4mg SL which was administered at 1528. At 1530, O2 sat was 98% on RA; pulse was 90; B/P was 122/90. At 1540, O2 sat was 96% on RA; pulse 88 - rechecked on Right hand which gave a reading of O2 sat of 98% on RA; pulse 94. At 1545, employee reported improvement of headache, itching, chest tightness, flushing, and SOB; however, was still vomiting almost coninuously. At 1550, O2 sat was 99% on RA; pulse 83. At 1600, B/P was 118/84; pulse 78; resp 20; O2 sat 98% on RA. He continued to vomit. At 1613, employee was taken via wheelchair to private vehicle of a friend and was taken to ER for evaluation.

20 hours after injection, I started having progressively worsening severe back pain, neck pain, headache, chills (no fever), skin sensitivity, noise sensitivity, fatigue, and brain fog. 2 days after the vaccine, I had abdominal pain, and cough. All of that is now better except for the cough. It is now 4 days after the vaccine, and it seems the vaccine has triggered an asthma attack requiring inhaled albuterol. My asthma attacks typically linger for a couple weeks after upper respiratory infections, and this feels exactly like that, I wouldn?t be surprised if this asthma attack persists for a couple of weeks.

30 2021-01-16 itchy rash, skin spots, itchy skin, rash, rash maculo-papular Allergic Skin Reaction: Moderate-severe pruritic maculo-papular rash present on bilateral hands incl... Read more
Close
Allergic Skin Reaction: Moderate-severe pruritic maculo-papular rash present on bilateral hands including 100% finger and palm involvement and ~20% dorsum of hand. Rash extends on anterior arm up to axilla. Rash also present in inguinal area and 100% of buttocks and extends down posterior leg down to knee. Petechiae present bilaterally on ventral hands hand finger tips (likely related to squeezing hands for itch relief) Rash was present around 60 hours after vaccination starting on buttocks and inguinal area and progressed to hands then armpits over the following day. Rash progressing in severity despite 50 mg oral Benadryl q6h, 40 mg oral prednisone daily, and topical hydrocortisone. Rash still present and progressing and no peak severity has been identified yet.

diffuse urticaria on my trunk and face/had recurrent diffuse urticaria, predominantly in the face; Associated with itching; mild abdominal discomfort; facial flushing; Persistent intermittent sweats, and significant fatigue; Persistent intermittent sweats, and significant fatigue; first dose given on 21Dec2020 and second dose on 07Jan2021 (Day 18); This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (reported for himself). A 30-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EK9231), via an unspecified route of administration on 07Jan2021 17:00 at a single dose on left arm for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included allergies to shellfish. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID prior to vaccination. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient received first dose of bnt162b2 on 21Dec2020 on left arm for COVID-19 immunization (lot number: EH9899). No any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 10Jan2021 18:00 (three days after second immunization), the patient developed diffuse urticaria on his trunk and face, associated with itching, mild abdominal discomfort, and facial flushing. Symptoms somewhat improved with cetirizine. About 24 hours later, he had recurrent diffuse urticaria, predominantly in the face, persistent intermittent sweats, and significant fatigue. Treatment was given to the patient for the adverse events. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included nasal swab (COVID test type post vaccination): negative on 11Jan2021. The patient has not recovered from the events.

experienced a rash on torso/Rash on Torso Chest and Neck/red/splotchy and a little itchy; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 30-years-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, lot number and expiry date not reported) via an unspecified route of administration on 10Jan2021 11:30 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included that patient was tested positive for Covid prior to the vaccine, in early to mid Oct2020. Concomitant medications included bupropion; and amfetamine aspartate, amfetamine sulfate, dexamfetamine saccharate, dexamfetamine sulfate (ADDERALL). He took his normal prescription medications in the morning the day of vaccination. Patient stated he received his first dose on Sunday, 10Jan2021 and 36hours, reported as last night 11Jan2021, he experienced a rash on torso, "red/splotchy and a little itchy, but bearable". He noticed that he was breaking out in a blotchy red rash on his torso and chest and it was not going away. It's not too itchy. He was calling to see if this was a normal side effect. He is not a HCP but works at a HCP office. He got his First Dose on 10Jan2021 at 11:30 and the rash started 11Jan2021 about 36 hours later. The Itching and spots showed up at the same time. The rash was only on the torso, chest, and neck. He was noticing that the rash was about the same as when it first started, and it gets worse when heat is applied like if he is in the shower. Patient has not taken any antibody tests and had no issues with vaccines in the past. He did not have to be hospitalized or seek further treatment for this rash. Patient wanted to report his side effects and "make sure it's nothing serious that needs to be addressed" and patient was asking for any information about report of rash and what needs to be done At the time of the report the patient felt fine and looked worse than he this it was. Patient asked if after experiencing side effects from the 1st dose, should he get the 2nd dose of vaccine. The outcome of the event rash on torso/rash on torso, chest and neck/red/splotchy and a little itchy was not recovered. Information on the batch/lot number has been requested.

Close
Fever and chills, debilitating headache, weakness and muscle aches, joint pain, nausea, and fatigue. Local swelling and pain at injection site. Also felt unusually anxious, though unsure if that was directly due to the vaccine or to the inability to sleep for a number of days because of the feverish chills. Acute symptoms lasted for 48 hours, and prohibited me from being able to work from home. I still have what feels like a lingering sinus headache (with no actual sinus symptoms) as well as some fatigue. Lingering headache is not debilitating, but it is irritating. Feels a bit like a sensation of pressure in my forehead.

PATIENT ARRIVED AT PHARMACY FEELING DIZZY, LIGHTHEADED AND ITCHYNESS ON FACE. NO TROUBLE BREATHING. SLIGHTLY IN PANICKED STATE. HE WAS DRIVING FROM A store ON THE WAY HOME AFTER RECEVING HIS VACCINATION WHEN HE EXPERIENCED THESE SYMPTOMS. STOPPED BY OUR store AFTER FEELING LIKE HE MAY PASS OUT FROM DIZZINESS. IMMEDIATELY HAD PATIENT SIT DOWN AND ADMINISTERED BENADRYL 50MG AFTER CHECKING PATIENT WAS ABLE TO BREATHE, SWALLOW, AND TALK. MONITORED PATIENT FOR THE NEXT 30 MINUTES UNTIL HE CLAIMED HE FELT MUCH BETTER AND WANTED TO DRIVE HOME. OFFERED TO CALL 911 WHEN HE SAT BUT PATIENT REFUSED. COUNSELED PATIENT ON DROWSINESS FROM BENADRYL AND THAT IT MAY WEAR OFF LATER.

30 2021-03-17 injection site pain 11pm on day of (Sunday) vaccination felt soreness in left arm at injection site and in entire upper ... Read more
Close
11pm on day of (Sunday) vaccination felt soreness in left arm at injection site and in entire upper arm when trying to hold it up. Soreness subsided by noon the next day, Monday. No symptoms on Tuesday until late evening when tongue began to feel sore. On Wednesday morning around 6am, woke up with severe body fever, chills, muscle and joint aches, nausea, headache. Hands and fingers very cold to the touch. Severe fatigue and weakness all day. Sore tongue persisted. No respiratory symptoms present. By Thursday (today), body is still feverish, joint and muscle aches persist, light headache at times. Still fatigued and weak. All symptoms today Thursday are much weaker except for the muscle and joint pain which remains high. The reason I am reporting this is that from what I've read and been told, the delayed onset of these symptoms (almost 3 days) is very unusual, especially because I had little/no symptoms in the first 2 days of the vaccine.

Pt reports that he started to feel lightheaded and stood up and passed out. pt then hit his chin on a low setting wall and had a small 1cm laceration on his anterior chin. pt fell prior to my arrival to finding him down. when I arrived pt seemed to be mildly disoriented for about 30 seconds to 1 minute. pt reports that he had + LOC for a few seconds while he fell but was conscious when I arrived. pt was advised to seek out wound closure for chin laceration.
30 2021-03-24 itchy skin After about 15-20 mins, patient started to experiencing symptoms of mild to moderate itching over se... Read more
Close
After about 15-20 mins, patient started to experiencing symptoms of mild to moderate itching over several different areas of skin. Patient acknowledged symptoms but felt that he was alright. Symptoms increased to moderate continuous itching most promiment on hands, forearms, lateral sides of neck. Patient had c/o of headache, slight dizziness, increased HR (sustained 110s) and increased BP (approx 184/130). Pulse ox was 99% on RA. No trouble breathing, no angioedema noted. Informed pharmacist and ambulated patient to ER for evaluation. ER continued observation, administered famotidine 20mg (oral), diphenhydramine 50mg (IM), dexamethasone 10mg (IM). Patient remained stable and was discharged within an hour with a steroid pack.
30 2021-03-25 redness Patient checked in to the observation room. A patient sitting adjacent reported he 'dropped his phon... Read more
Close
Patient checked in to the observation room. A patient sitting adjacent reported he 'dropped his phone and was out' momentarily. The patient did not fall and MD was alerted. Patient was red, flushed, clammy but alert. BP 73/42mmHg, HR 85, O2sat 97%, and RR 12. He was placed on a stretcher. He had no difficulty breathing or cutaneous symptoms. BP recovered to 120/75mmHg, HR 80, O2sat 96% and RR 12 within 15 minutes. Pt felt well and was able to be discharged home.

30 2021-04-24 skin discolouration more than likely an allergic reaction to the vaccine; Purple splotches; Dizzy and woozy; Nausea; Hea... Read more
Close
more than likely an allergic reaction to the vaccine; Purple splotches; Dizzy and woozy; Nausea; Headache; Feels awful/slow motion; Tired; Sluggish; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 30-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 22Mar2021 at 12:30 at the age of 30 years-old, (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation . Medical history included dyspepsia from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing Verbatim: Severe Heartburn , blood pressure measurement from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing Verbatim: Blood pressure , migraine from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. Concomitant medication(s) included lisinopril (LISINOPRIL) taken for blood pressure for 3 years and ongoing; pantoprazole (PANTOPRAZOLE) taken for stomach medication and heartburn for about a year. Patient states he got the first round 3 weeks ago and he is supposed to get the second dose next Monday but was advised by his doctor not to do that. Patient states he got the shot on Monday 22Mar2021 and Tuesday 23Mar2021 he was tired and sluggish. On Wednesday 24Mar2021, mid afternoon, he had purple splotches all over his body, in arms and legs, like discoloration, his head felt like it had been dipped in cement and he couldn't think. States he felt cloudy, dizzy and woozy, nauseous, had a headache and feeling awful. States this occurred like 48 hours after the shot. He contacted a life long friend who is a doctor and works in a covid ward and he told him he was having a reaction and to take some Benadryl and Advil or Tylenol, and the friend told the patient to lay down and rest. He still didn't feel great but splotches went away and head felt a little bit clearer and he didn't feel like he was in slow motion or dizzy anymore by Wednesday evening, so he went to bed. On Thursday, the patient went into work but didn't feel great, not feeling 100%, and about noon on Thursday 25Mar2021, the symptoms started coming back, the purple splotches, his head felt just as bad, he had a headache, slow motion and not himself. The patient called his doctor and his friend and they said he needed to go in and get looked at. The patient tried to go into an urgent care and he states they said nope head to the ER. Patient states he was admitted into the ER and the ER staff said he was having more than likely an allergic reaction to the vaccine. They gave him steroids and an IV but he is not sure what it is and he was given, he thinks, Prednisone over the next couple days to help with side effects, he believes it was Prednisone, he knows it was a steroid. States he is not a fan of it and he doesn't like it at all. Patient states that he thought it was a pretty standard reaction and was not worried about it. Patient states he still gets headaches and maybe it's something else that is unrelated. States he stopped feeling tired and sluggish maybe the 29Mar2021, a week afterwards. Patient states that he has recovered with lasting effects as he's been getting migraines since then, states maybe it's unrelated but didn't happen a whole lot before. He has severe headaches and nothing he takes seems to help, has to turn lights off and works from home and patient reports that he had one yesterday. Patient states the purple splotches went away after he went to the ER and got on the medicine, the steroids. P atient states the nausea was pretty constant when a headache comes on, he doesn't have a headache every day but when he gets a headache he is definitely nauseous. The outcome of the events was for fatigue and sluggish, recovered with sequela, Purple splotches, dizzy and woozy slow motion, recovered, nausea and headache not recovered. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

Close
1. Pulsing pain at dose administration site at 11 pm. -No treatment, went to sleep. 2. (12 hrs after administration). Woke up at 1:00 am with severe chills. Lasted 2 hours. -Threw on sweats and another blanket, went back to sleep. 3. Woke up at 6:30 am with intense body and head pain. "was a cant get comfortable in any position type of pulsing pain" Something im accustomed to when i get the Flu. I rolled around in pain for 4 hours while trying to go back to sleep; it even hurt to breathe deeply. - took Tylenol at 11am and the symptoms never came back. *Note. I think i suffered so much pain in the 4 hours that it lasted with me until even now as i write this. Hard to describe, but my entire body has had this tiny ache that has not gone away. Not a big deal to me, but just wanted it documented. I am selecting recovered even with that tiny ache still apparent because physical pain usually takes time to heal. Assuming that's all it is.
31 2021-01-07 blister, bruising I have start developing a red bruise like the bubbles on my arm; it seems more like under skin there... Read more
Close
I have start developing a red bruise like the bubbles on my arm; it seems more like under skin there is a bubble and not like inflammatory muscles; I have start developing a red bruise like the bubbles on my arm; it seems more like under skin there is a bubble and not like inflammatory muscles; administered via sub cutaneous with a half inch needle; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Pharmacist reporting for himself. A 31-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EK5730 and expiry date: 31Mar2021), Subcutaneously on 29Dec2020 at 16:40 at single dose at Left Deltoid at Hospital for Prevention. There were no medical history or concomitant medications. There were no prior vaccinations within 4 weeks, no family medical history, and no additional vaccines administered on same date of Pfizer suspect. The patient wanted to know what the recommendations are if the COVID Vaccine was administered subcutaneously. He clarified he received the COVID Vaccine, but he believed it was administered via sub cutaneous with a half inch needle on 29Dec2020 at 16:40. He knew with other vaccines such as the Flu Vaccine, if it is not given intramuscularly, a patient is subject to revaccination. The patient wanted to know if he needs to be revaccinated with the COVID Vaccine since it wasn't an intramuscular injection. Relevant Tests were None. On 01Jan2021, the patient stated that he had started developing a red bruise like the bubbles on his arm; it seemed more like under the skin there was a bubble and not like inflammatory muscles. The patient reported that the shot was given with the half inch of needle because it was only recommended with the one inch or larger; so actually, he was trying to find it on the mail. The question he wanted to ask was if it went to the deep muscle enough or possibly into the tissue. But over the last, like 24 hours, he has started developing a red bruise like the bubbles on his arm. It didn't feel like he ever had any muscle pain or anything and it seemed more like under the skin there was a bubble and not like inflammatory muscles. The patient's weight was reported as 104.33 kg or 230 pounds. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. Outcome of the events was unknown. Causality between the event "I have start developing a red bruise like the bubbles on my arm; it seems more like under skin there is a bubble and not like inflammatory muscles" and BNT162B2 was reported as related. Follow-up (01Jan2021): New information received from a contactable pharmacist includes additional events (contusion, blister), an additional laboratory data, and the clinical course of the events.

Approximately five minutes after vaccination the patient developed linear erythema extending into the right distal forearm and ulnar aspect of the hand. This was mildly pruritic. there were no other systemic cardiac, respiratory, or GI symptoms. Vital signs remained stable and WNL. Treatment was started with 25 mg PO Benadryl. Over the next 30 minutes the symptoms significantly lessened. Patient was discharged without further signs.

31 2021-01-13 injection site pain I had soreness around my arm of injection site for about 3 days. I also wanted to let you all kn... Read more
Close
I had soreness around my arm of injection site for about 3 days. I also wanted to let you all know that I had a sore throat that started the day after my first dose. Sore throat started off as mild but later got worse by the 2nd day. I also experienced a mild grade fever, headaches, and chills which went away in a couple of days. HOWEVER, today (1-14-2021) I decided to rule out the possibility of me having COVID. So I got tested for covid and I was tested positive via the RT-PCR at a local urgent care facility. So with that being said I am not quite sure if the sore throat, mild grade fever, headaches, and chills were part because of the vaccine dose (first dose) or it could have been from experiencing covid symptoms. Treatment I used were drinking LOTS of water, Tylenolol and Advil, Cephacol lozenges, and sleep.

No treatments received in response to the events reported. The events were reported as not serious (did not result in death, not life-threatening, did not cause/prolonged hospitalization, not disabling/incapacitating and not a congenital anomaly/birth defect). 31 2021-01-14 itchy skin Within 2-5 minutes of receiving the vaccine, I began to feel dizzy. I signaled for help while in my... Read more
Close
Within 2-5 minutes of receiving the vaccine, I began to feel dizzy. I signaled for help while in my car and help arrived. Within the next few minutes the severity seemed to go from ?0-100? and I began to feel a deep impending sense of doom and panic/fear. I also felt extremely tense in my muscles and felt itchy in the chest area. That continued for 15 minutes or so before subsiding slowly. Staff surrounded my car and were very supportive and great about the situation. It was one of the most frightening experiences to date I have had. No EpiPen type intervention was done. Once the event was on the downswing I was kept for additional observation and release on my own accord. Everyone there was great. I am reporting for my own records in case further testing reveals I have an allergy to this vaccine for employment purposes should the vaccine become mandated prior to me having alternative means of vaccination or allergy testing competed to determine if it was an true reaction or not so I can get vaccinated safely.

Close
Approx. 15 min after receiving vaccine, patient c/o itching along his back and chest which progressed to his arms and head. Small area of urticaria noted along back (likely secondary to scratching). Patient was given 50 mg of Benadryl. Denied any cp/palp/sob./fever/chills/dysphagia. His heart rate was slightly elevated (HR=91-100) but BP remained wnl (123/82). His 02 saturation in room air remained 99%. Patient was monitored with serial vitals for 2 hours and discharged home with instructions regarding contacting 911 or go to nearest ER if symptoms returned/worsen. Next day, patient return to clinic, symptoms resolved, exam was wnl. Patient advised to f/u with immunologist/allergist for evaluation if safe to receive Dose 2 in 21-42 days. In the interim, patient was advised not to receive the second dose unless cleared by Allergist/Immunology provider.

A 31-Year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 mRNA vaccine, Lot Number EL9262 and Expiration Date unknown) via Intramuscular on 03Feb2021 09:45 AM (vaccine location: Left arm) at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Immediate injection location pain and left chest pain on 03Feb2021 10:00. Continuous left chest pain and headache for about 12 hours on day one. Symptoms similar to migratory arthritis randomly occur from day two to four, mainly in both knees, left groin, and left wrist. The outcome of events was recovering without treatment was given. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and the plausible drug-event temporal association, a possible contributory role of the suspect product BNT162B2 to the development of event Migratory arthritis cannot be excluded. The case will be reassessed if additional information becomes available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Patient is a 31yo male ADSM with a hx of eosinic esophagitis, received Pfizer Covid vaccine #1 and had positive PCR to Covid-19 wild type infection day 9 after receipt. He experienced fatigue, malaise, ear pain, head congestion, fever day 1-3, followed by general improvement but development of a diffuse erythematous maculopapular pruritic exanthem, loss of taste and smell day 4, and episodic bloody diarrhea day 6 or 7. The exanthem has had limited (if any) response to steroid (day 5-9) and he has continued to self treat with Benadryl and atarax at home. He has just been released from quarantine. The dermatitis is improved but not resolved. CBC and CMP were normal.

1) Injection site soreness, intensified approximately 3 hours after injection, peak at 24 hours after injection. Woke twice from description of bullet point 4 due to bowel movement. Resolved by 24 hours. 3) Muscle pain/tightness in other locations of body, such as upper left thigh, right shoulder, right buttock starting approximately 24 hours after injection. These were not experienced prior to vaccine, although occasional skeletal related pain in right shoulder from prior injury one year prior is reported. 4) Fatigue began approximately 6 hours after injection, drowsiness following where patient was somnolent 12 hours after injection (4 to 5 hours prior to typical sleep time for patient).
