A 31-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) (Lot Number: EN6208), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 17Mar2021 14:00 as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included meniere's disease. Concomitant medications included gabapentin; atorvastatin; pantoprazole; acetazolamide all taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. There was no other vaccine in four weeks. The patient experienced rectal hemorrhage pain in the administered area on 17Mar2021 17:45 with outcome of unknown. Patient didn't receive treatment for the adverse events. Patient didn't have covid prior vaccination nor tested covid post vaccination.
31 2021-04-09 injection site discomfort, injection site pain When the needle entered my arm, that felt normal. But I felt extreme pressure and immediate pain as ... Read more
Close
When the needle entered my arm, that felt normal. But I felt extreme pressure and immediate pain as soon as the plunger got depressed. After the needle was removed, I continued to feel pain within my shoulder, not at the injection site. On my ride home, the pain started to worsen and was very painful when I got home, throughout my shoulder joint. I took Advil when I got home, and have taken it very 6 hours since, along with lots of water. I have used a heating pad with some immediate relief but no improvement in the pain. I am trying to stretch and move the arm, but am requiring assistance with even that because of how much pain is involved with simple movements. It does not seem nerve related as it does not radiate down my arm. The pain is isolated to my shoulder joint.

Close
Fever, chills, headache, sore arm, swollen arm, lethargy, sensitive and sore skin. These began within 6 hours of the shot and were debilitating for 48 hours. Severe for 49-72 hours and then fever broke and other symptoms gradually subsided over next 48 hours. At some (unknown) time after the vaccine, I developed viral pericarditis. In addition to the above, this manifested in chest pain (no difficulty breathing) which radiated from what felt like the lungs, through my windpipe, into a sore throat, jaw muscles hurting, inner ear and neck soreness. These symptoms lasted after all had subsided and didn?t disappear until 14 days after the 2nd vaccine.

32 2021-01-09 redness, hives Anaphylaxis Please note previous VAERS report of Bell's Palsy 8 days following the first dose and s... Read more
Close
Anaphylaxis Please note previous VAERS report of Bell's Palsy 8 days following the first dose and subsequently treated with prednisone and valacyclovir. This neurologic diagnosis was not reported by the patient during the consent process with the COVID19 vaccination center staff. Confirmed following review of the consent form. Documentation from Emergency Department Provider: Patient is serially reassessed following treatment for anaphylaxis. Patient has significant improvement in diffuse erythema and hives within 20 minutes. He has gradual improvement in his sensation of throat swelling. He is observed while in the emergency department serially over 4 hours with no recurrence of symptoms. He does not require any repeat dose of epinephrine and feels at baseline. Discussed my suspicions that patient may have had a reaction to COVID-19 vaccine as he has had no other new medications or exposures that he is aware of. As he will not be receiving another vaccine there is nothing to necessarily stay away from. Make sure he notifies individuals about this for any new vaccine should he receive them. Patient is observed for sufficient time but discussed possibility for biphasic reaction. Recommend he return should he have recurrence of symptoms. Recommend he take EpiPen as prescribed for any throat swelling or progressive shortness of breath. Recommend follow-up with a primary care provider for this visit..

Patient stated this was not supposed to be done within 14 days. He stated that CDC mentioned that three vaccines that were possible to do this but unknown safety hazards to doing this. Stated that it did not mention Hepatitis B. Stated it was an error on nurse's judgement. He stated there was a second co-administration to happen on Monday, patient was scheduled for the same day as the 2nd Hep B vaccine (unknown date), but that she was on vacation. He stated that the person could not find Hepatitis B vaccine. He stated that his original paperwork was not filed. He stated that he got a second COVID 19 on Monday, and on Wednesday (13Jan2021) they realized they were not supposed to give vaccinations like that, the error was caught, and he would not get the second Hepatitis B vaccine. Stated that he was unaware of any symptoms that occurred immediately after vaccination. He wanted to know how to proceed from this point. Patient stated that It was the person in charge of vaccinations told him there was no problem giving co-administration of COVID-19 vaccine. He also reported mild adverse events after both COVID vaccines which include not too much pain around the injection site, some nausea 10-12 hours after the injection; felt woozy/small bouts of dizziness, pain in the left arm at 17:00 (to point could not lift or sleep on it), rise in temperature of 97.7 to 99.9 (also reported as for 5-6 days were at 99.9 never breaking 100) on 18Dec2020. Treatment was not given for all events. Patient had blood work done on an unspecified date with unknown results, and rise in temperature of 97.7 to 99.9 on 18Dec2020 and 11Jan2021. Outcome of the events rise in temperature of 97.7 to 99.9, pain in the left arm was recovered on an unspecified date; events felt woozy/small bouts of dizziness and felt nausea was recovered on 18Dec2020, while outcome of not too much pain around the injection site was unknown.

32 2021-02-16 shingles Swollen lymph nodes; Developed Shingles on his face; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable... Read more
Close
Swollen lymph nodes; Developed Shingles on his face; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other healthcare professional. This other healthcare professional reported for a 32-year-old male patient (her fiance). A 32-year-old male patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, lot number and expiration date were not reported), via an unspecified route of administration at the right arm on 29Jan2021 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history was not reported. There were no concomitant medications. The patient previously took the first dose of bnt162b2 on 08Jan2021 for COVID-19 immunization. The patient developed shingles on his face on 31Jan2021 and swollen lymph nodes on 01Feb2021. The events were reported as serious (medically significant) and worsened. There were no investigation assessment. The patient had not recovered from the events at the time of the report. Information on the batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on the compatible temporal association and the drug's known safety profile, the Company considers the event swollen lymph nodes is possibly related to suspect vaccine BNT162B2. Other than a temporal association, there is no evidence or argument to suggest a causal relationship between BNT162B2 and the event shingles, which is likely an intercurrent condition. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Close
About two weeks after first shot, I got shingles. It could be unrelated, but since I'm young, perfectly healthy, not abnormally stressed, and haven't ever had singles before, I thought there might be a chance it is related. I've seen online other young people who are saying that they got shingles after the first shot of Moderna or Pfizer. Maybe it was just a coincidence, but I figured it was worth reporting. It is overall a pretty mild case because I got on the antiviral drugs pretty quickly. Wondering if I should still get my second shot on schedule or wait until my shingles is all cleared. I have asked my doctor and am awaiting a response. I first noticed the symptoms on Saturday (3/20) exactly two weeks after my first shot.

Fainting; Swelling of arms and hands; Feeling hot; Hives on the face and limbs; Shortness of breath; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 32-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection) (at 32 years of age), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm left on 31Mar2021 14:30 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0150) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history was None. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccine within 4 weeks prior to the covid vaccine. He was not diagnosed with Covid-19 prior to vaccination. He has not been tested for covid since the vaccination. He had no allergies to medications, food, or other products. The patient experienced swelling of arms and hands, feeling hot, hives on the face and limbs. He also had shortness of breath and fainting. The events started on 31Mar2021 18:45 with outcome of recovered with sequelae. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the events as the patient was administered with IV saline, steroids and antihistamine. The events resulted to Emergency room/department or urgent care. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

On 12/30 - he reports his arm is sore and he still feels itchy. Now he has some nausea and his joints hurt. He plans to stay home from work to rest today. He had to leave work early yesterday (works night shift). 12/31 - reports he feels better but still has a headache and feels achy. He hasn't taken the hydroxyzine because his itching is not as intense. 1/4 employee reports his symptoms have improved and has mild achiness, fatigue, and itching which he describes as 1-2 on a scale of 1-10.

33 2021-01-27 injection site pain About an hour after I received my second shot I felt extremely hot and my knees and elbows started t... Read more
Close
About an hour after I received my second shot I felt extremely hot and my knees and elbows started to hurt. I felt so hot that I walked outside to my car (about .3 miles away) in freezing cold temperatures with no jacket and didn't feel the cold at all. I developed a brain fog shortly thereafter and made several mistakes while performing my job throughout the day. My supervisor provided me with extra strength tylenol and within an hour or so the joint pains subsided. By 7 PM that night I had very bad chills and was shaking under a blanket on my couch. My temperature got up to 99.8 which is pretty high for me. I went back and forth between feeling like I was freezing cold and on fire. I got very little sleep that night and had disturbing dreams. The following morning all my joints hurt and I felt extreme exhaustion. I laid on my couch all day the day after receiving the shot and felt exhausted and and had no appetite. From 6 PM the day of the shot to 9 PM the following day I ate NOTHING and had no desire to eat. As I'm typing this 60 hours after receiving the second shot the joint pain is gone, the exhaustion is gone and my appetite is back to normal. There's a lingering pain at the injection site but otherwise I feel like I did prior to receiving the second shot.

second dose of Covid 19 Vaccine on 11Jan2021; little pain around the injection site; some nausea; some bouts of dizziness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 33-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Lot Number: EJ1685), via an unspecified route of administration on 11Jan2021 at single dose on right arm, mid bicep for COVID-19 immunization. There were no patient history. Concomitant medications included hepatitis b vaccine on 14Dec2020, colecalciferol (VITAMIN D [COLECALCIFEROL]), calcium and vitamin c [ascorbic acid] (VITAMIN C [ASCORBIC ACID]). The patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Lot Number:EK5730) on 18Dec2020 (left arm) and he experienced little pain around the injection site, some nausea and some bouts of dizziness. The patient received the Covid 19 Vaccine 4 days after receiving the Hepatitis B vaccination, so he identified this as an error in administration. So the Hepatitis B vaccination was given on 14Dec2020 and the first Covid 19 Vaccine was given on 18Dec2020. He received the second dose of Covid 19 Vaccine on 11Jan2021. Patient stated that originally the prescriber who administered it the first two doses had scheduled him to receive the second dose of Covid 19 Vaccine as the same day as his second Hepatitis B Vaccination and he identified this error last Wednesday and stated "I believe or potentially today, I'm not sure which one I'm sorry I had to check with that". So, he was trying to get this all cleared up. He did report symptoms for both Covid Vaccines as little pain around the injection site, some nausea, some bouts of dizziness. So, patient had already discussed the common adverse reactions with him. Patient was told that co-administration has not been studied yet and referred him to his HCP for continued guidance on how and when to space out the additional Hepatitis B vaccination that he will need. Patient was "32" back in December when this happened. He had his birthday and turned 33. Second shot for the Covid was scheduled the same day the Hep B (Hepatitis B Vaccine) but due to inveigle in-charge of the vaccine, he had lost his paper work and he had been on vacation and stated "had been vaccine was not found they just gave me the second Covid Vaccine and told me to come back by Thursday and I should have found it and have everything cleared up by then but then Wednesday they called me and told me that they have realized that they are not supposed to give vaccine co-administered with 14 days window before or after. I haven't got my second Hep B (Hepatitis B Vaccine) just the first one was administered within the 4 days period of the first shot". Patient work at Dietary Providence. The patient had his blood drawn this morning (20Jan2021). Patient does not have product details for hepatitis B vaccine. Patient stated that the nurse on duty had said that the vaccine they had stocks was "Engerix-B hepatitis B recombinant" but that was not verified as far as definitively is just what she had stocked when he was going on his incident report. Patient further stated, "As far as all things are concerned you know I went to a doctor got checked he said breathing was great, heart rate was great, oxygen level 98 percent, he has drawn blood by then is there anything that I should be doing at this point cataloging thing any other test any other people to contact. What should I do going forward specially what can I do to be helpful for you guys to get this situation clear." Outcome of the events was unknown.

After the shot (24h) the patient felt intense itching on face on 10Jan2021; subsequent hair loss has remained permanent since. The event alopecia barbae was reported to have resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, disability or permanent damage. No treatment was given for the events. The outcome of the events was not recovered. The patient did not have COVID prior vaccination and was not COVID tested post vaccination.; Sender's Comments: The causal relationship between BNT162B2 and the reported events cannot be excluded as the information available in this report is limited and does not allow a medically meaningful assessment. This case will be reassessed once additional information becomes available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to RAs, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.
33 2021-03-13 rash Bloody nose, fever, headache, rash on ears and neck
33 2021-03-14 rash Swollen right eye; Rash under the eye; Fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable cons... Read more
Close
Swollen right eye; Rash under the eye; Fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient) via a Pfizer sales representative. A 33-years-old male consumer received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) on 01Mar2021 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient was administered the Pfizer Covid19 vaccine on 01Mar2021 and experienced a swollen right eye with a rash under the eye. He also said he experienced fatigue. The outcome of the events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

Progress Notes R.N. (REGISTERED NURSE) ? ? Urology Patient is a 33 yr old male on 03/13/21 approximately 17:35 PM for 1st covid Pfizer vaccine Reviewed allergies and vaccine covid vaccine information provided to member. Allergies: Seafood, general rash, itchy and hives . 1st dose Pfizer given IM at 17:42 PM via left deltoid 5 minutes later started itching, redness bilateral hands Gen: Alert nontoxic No chest pain or dyspnea Pt denies Resp Distress Wheezing: no No SOB,tongue or Throat Swelling: no At :17:43 PM; 25 mgl/10 ml liquid Benadryl given PO NDC # 0121-0978-10 Lot # 4EF Expired Date: 11/21 At 17:45 PM second dosef 25 mg /10 ml liquid Benadryl given PO Lot # C4EF EXP: 11/21 Blood pressure : 151/101, sat 98%, RR 16. (left arm) At 18:00 PM; Blood pressure 144/104, hr 79, rr 16. Sat 97%. Right arm blood pressure 140/94 No sob or wheezing, no chest pain No Throat swelling At 18:15 PM: developed macular/Papular rash through out upper and lower ext, with severe itching At 18:25 PM, Accompanied member to ER, report given to ER charge nurse Pt registered via call center staff at PM. Pt in room 7,ER waiting to be seen per ER provider Approximately 19:15 PM Report given to ER provider. Approximately 19:45 PM member moved to room 8, resting,on cardiac monitor, states feeling sleepy now. Mother and sister waiting in the waiting area in ER, they both were made awarded. Completed by: RN, March 14, 2021, 12:46 PM 20:00 PM Primary Director was informed Completed by: March 14, 2021, 12:48 PM Allergic Reaction SUBJECTIVE Patient is a 33 yr old male presenting with allergic reaction for approximately 30 min. Accompanied by nurse upstairs that administered vaccine and gave 50 mg of benadryl as well. o Associated sx: rash o SOB, Tongue or Throat Swelling: No o Exposure/Trigger: covid vaccine 5 minutes later started itching and with rash o Any treatment prior to arrival: antihistamines Relevant medical history reviewed/updated. ROS All other aspects of the 10 point ROS performed and negative other than the pertinent positives and negatives listed below and in the HPI GENERAL No fever, weight loss CARD No chest pain or dyspnea on exertion PHYSICAL EXAM Vitals: BP (!) 148/96 | Pulse 83 | Temp 98.8 °F (37.1 °C) (Tympanic) | Resp 16 | Ht 5' 6" (1.676 m) | Wt 182 lb (82.6 kg) | SpO2 98% | BMI 29.38 kg/m² GEN Alert, nontoxic EYES PERRL, EOMI, anicteric HEENT Lingual edema: No Hydropic Uvula: No Airway Patent: Yes Mucosal Lesions: No NECK Supple, FROM CARD RRR, No murmurs RESP RR nl, No Resp Distress Wheezing: none EXT Well perfused, no deformity NEURO A&Ox3, moving all ext SKIN Rash: Macular/Papular through out upper and lower ext Skin Desquamation: No ASSESSMENT/PLAN Evaluation most supportive of allergic reaction. o Evidence of anaphylaxis, respiratory distress or airway compromise: No o Concern for Stevens-Johnson Syndrome or Erythema Multiforme Major No Tx/Plan: o Benadryl 50 mg given immediately after vaccine administration o Solumedrol given here with improvement in rash and redness after 1 hour o Discussed taking prednisone for the next 5 days and benadryl q6 at home. o Do not get second vaccine. 03/13/21 2025 Other Notes All notes ED Notes from L.P.N. Sunday, headache began to form. The, what appeared to be bite marks, found on right leg. Monday, day long headache. Tuesday, horrible headache, nausea, night sweats, chills. ER diagnosed it as reaction from spider bite. Wednesday, headaches, more bumps. Thursday, headaches, nausea. Friday, headaches, more bumps on right leg, itching on right leg, ringing in right ear. Contacted doctor on Friday with pictures, and he diagnosed it as shingles.
33 2021-03-21 itchy skin, injection site pain 33y/o male reports itching on the bottom of both feet at ~17min post-Pfizer vaccination into the lef... Read more
Close
33y/o male reports itching on the bottom of both feet at ~17min post-Pfizer vaccination into the left arm on 3/17/21. He states that he has h/o allergic reactions that typically present this way. He reports pain at injection site that he rates as a 3/10. He has associated itching/tingling sensation that he rates as a 2/10. He also feels flushed/heat in his face. He denies throat discomfort/swelling, difficulty breathing, shortness of breath, chest pain, palpitations, blurry vision, dizziness, lip/tongue swelling, or nasal congestion. Patient reports resolved sensations at 35min post-injection. He reports h/o allergic reactions to river water, Chantix, Zyrtec and seasonal allergies. He states that he has never needed epinephrine and his past symptoms resolved without intervention and he was monitored. Physical Exam: BP; 155/110 Cardiac: regular heart rate and rhythm. Radial Pulse 2+ Lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally Skin: no rash, erythema, or injection site redness/swelling Plan: Patient reported symptoms resolved at 35min after injection and left clinic. He was advised to call 911 if he develops any allergic reactions or respiratory issues including hives, difficulty breathing, chest pain, or throat/lip/tongue swelling. He was also informed that his blood pressure was high and that he would need to follow up with his PCP. Patient reports that it typically rises when he speaks to providers.
33 2021-03-23 redness 10 to 15 minutes after receiving the vaccination. The patient reported to a pharmacy technician the... Read more
Close
10 to 15 minutes after receiving the vaccination. The patient reported to a pharmacy technician they were feeling unwell. As the patient went to sit down they fainted. Patient was unresponsive for roughly a minute exhibiting tensed arm and neck muscles. Muscles also contracted several times during the episode. Patients eyes were open during the episode but they could not be coaxed to speak signal or blink. Additional patient symptomology as follows: elevated pulse, constricted pupils, flushing/redness in the face & neck. For this reason, medical staff called 911. Patient became responsive and reported losing consciousness and having no recollection of majority of the event. Upon arrival EMT's took over patient care. Patient left with EMT's

33 2021-04-20 redness he feels like his throat is so raw; Second COVID-19 vaccine: sore arm; Second COVID-19 vaccine: feel... Read more
Close
he feels like his throat is so raw; Second COVID-19 vaccine: sore arm; Second COVID-19 vaccine: feeling achy/ Her husband is still sore/achy today; Second COVID-19 vaccine: nauseous; Second COVID-19 vaccine: vomiting/ throwing up; Second COVID-19 vaccine: diarrhea; Second COVID-19 vaccine: fatigue; vomiting blood; Second COVID-19 vaccine: blood in the phlegm or just whatever he spit up / spitting up blood; Second COVID-19 vaccine: Chilly; Second COVID-19 vaccine: redness around his eyes, like under his eyelids; his pores looked red; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (wife). A 33-year-old patient (husband) received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration administered in right arm on 05Apr2021 15:40 (Lot Number: ER8734) at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included atopic dermatitis. Concomitant medication included dupilumab (DUPIXENT), an injection that patient takes every other week to control his atopic dermatitis, he has been using this for 3 years at least. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 (Lot number: ER6207) in left shoulder on 15Mar2021 15:40, at the age of 32 years old, for COVID-19 immunization, and experienced arm sore and body aches. The patient experienced vomiting blood in Apr2021, blood in the phlegm or just whatever he spit up / spitting up blood in Apr2021, he feels like his throat is so raw on 05Apr2021, sore arm on 05Apr2021, feeling achy/ her husband is still sore/achy today on 05Apr2021, nauseous on 05Apr2021, vomiting/ throwing up on 05Apr2021, diarrhea on 05Apr2021, chilly in Apr2021, redness around his eyes, like under his eyelids; his pores looked red in Apr2021, fatigue on 05Apr2021. No treatment received for the adverse events. Outcome of the events pain in arm, ache, nauseous, erythema, fatigue was not recovered, of the other events was unknown. Clinical course as reported: Her husband got their second dose of the vaccine on 05Apr2021. Her husband was having a more severe reaction than the first time. The first time he got the vaccine his arm was sore. Last night (05Apr2021), the caller's husband was vomiting just over and over and had diarrhea, both at the same time. Wife added the thing she was worried about was that her husband was vomiting blood as well, and that her husband said it was from the phlegm, like he felt like his throat was so raw. Her husband did not really want to eat anything which she expected was normal. She was trying to give him fluids, and having him drink a little bit. Her husband had not vomited since around 4 am. And right now, he was sleeping. She did not know if she should give him medicine or take him to be seen or if this was a normal reaction to the vaccination. She did read side effects from the paper and she saw that some vomiting was expected but the blood was what caught her off guard. Around 10 o'clock last night (05Apr2021), her husband felt nauseous and went to bed. She actually fell asleep on the couch and heard her husband vomiting across the house, that was how bad the vomiting was. The vomiting started at midnight last night (05Apr2021). Her husband has been vomiting every couple of hours (2 hours), around the clock. Diarrhea had been at the same time. From her understanding, her husband had vomited at least 3 or 4 times, and had diarrhea 3 or 4 times. She kind of lost track after the 3rd time, but she had not heard him since around 4 am Her husband was still sore/achy today (06Apr2020) and was is still nauseous. She believed he was also feeling chilly. He was wrapped up in his blanket. Her husband did not have a fever, she has been checking his temperature. Wife stated no treatment yet, as she did not know what was safe. Her husband wanted to wait until he stopped vomiting because anything he put in his stomach came right back up. After the first time her husband was done throwing up, and was only dry heaving, he started to like kind of spit. When he would gargle or spit, there was blood in the phlegm or just whatever he spit up. The first time the wife went to check on him, she saw him spitting up blood. It was not like his vomit was red with blood in it, it was just the after effects, so she thought she should call and report this. Each time he has vomited, there was still that spit up of blood afterwards. The patient himself clarified the vomiting was last around 4 am (06Apr2020), give or take, and the last stool/bout of diarrhea was around 7 am (06Apr2020). He was still feeling nauseous and fatigued. He added that after the first time he vomited and the couple times he checked later on, he looked in the mirror and saw that there was this redness around his eyes, like under his eyelids. He adds it was red, it wasn't like splotchy, but it was like his pores looked red, like pinpoints. The patient clarified that the fatigue and achiness probably started around the first time he vomited, and that was still hanging around. The wife stated this was better than him getting Covid. Wife added what she was trying to see was if she should take her husband to the hospital or not. She did not want to wait too long, but if this was something that was a side effect that was expected, then her husband could just sleep it off.
33 2021-05-07 redness, rash, itchy skin severe headaches; strong pain in my head, my left arm and left eye; strong pain in my head, my left ... Read more
Close
severe headaches; strong pain in my head, my left arm and left eye; strong pain in my head, my left arm and left eye; light pressure during the morning in my head not as severe as the other days; whole body turned red; bumps; itchy; nausea; stomach ache; eyes were numb; left arm was numb; rash all over his body; chills; flu symptoms; Caller (male, age 33) spoke already to someone prior to Pfizer and gave information on his experience with the Pfizer covid vaccine. "I took the first dose of the Pfizer vaccine on Saturday 17APR2021. I got a severe reaction from the Pfizer vaccine. I got the normal chills the next day and flu symptoms. From the next day to day 5 I got severe headaches, strong pain in my head, my left arm and left eye. I took Tylenol and ibuprofen within those days. The Tylenol didn't help at all, ibuprofen 200mg didn't do much. Yesterday I went to the ER because I had light pressure during the morning in my head not as severe as the other days, in the afternoon I had a tight pressure in my head so I took 2 tablets of extra strength Tylenol, the headache went away but within an hour I had a bad reaction. My whole body turned red, bumps, itchy. It was bad. It was bizarre because I've never had reaction to Tylenol prior. I never had that before yesterday. It was the first time. They gave me a shot of steroids. The doctor didn't know if it was a bad reaction to the Pfizer reaction (said it would usually occur within 4 hours of getting the vaccine) or the mix of the Tylenol and the pfizer vaccine together. He had no clue. But he had not seen a reaction of the vaccine at 5 days later. He said I could have reacted late, or the Tylenol and Pfizer vaccine together had a bad reaction. I had covid late Jan of this year. The vaccine more interaction due to that if I had immunity to it. It was so bad I don't know if it's possible to wait 2 months for the 2nd shot. I heard the first dose 80-90 percent immunity or even more. With my body I never had this reaction. Today I'm a whole lot better (day 6). I am too putting too much, should I wait 90 days other say 4 weeks. What to do about the 2nd dose? How about using antihistamines during/after my second dose? What about Tylenol or Ibuprofen?" I had a side effect after the first dose of the vaccine. Should I get the second dose? e-transmitting potential duplicate AE. Caller said he didn't give PCP information to the safety agent. He did not have. Response: Spoke from EUA PI (Revised: 06 April 2021) under Post Authorization Experience Fact Sheet for Recipients and Caregivers (Revised: 06 April 2021) under section WHAT ARE THE RISKS OF THE PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE? As noted in the Fact Sheet for Recipients, you should not get the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine if you had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of the vaccine or if you had a severe allergic reaction to any ingredient of the vaccine. The decision to receive the second dose for any other reason cannot be made by Pfizer. We refer you to speak to your healthcare provider about the risks of the vaccine compared to the risks of potentially not being fully protected against COVID-19 infection. Your healthcare provider knows your health situation and has access to information that can better help inform this decision. Request Name: Product: PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE Caller (male, age 33) spoke already to someone prior to Pfizer MI and gave information on his experience with the Pfizer covid vaccine. "I took the first dose of the Pfizer vaccine on Saturday 17APR2021. I got a severe reaction from the Pfizer vaccine. I got the normal chills the next day and flu symptoms. From the next day to day 5 I got severe headaches, strong pain in my head, my left arm and left eye. I took Tylenol and ibuprofen within those days. The Tylenol didn't help at all, ibuprofen 200mg didn't do much. Yesterday I went to the ER because I had light pressure during the morning in my head not as severe as the other days, in the afternoon I had a tight pressure in my head so I took 2 tablets of extra strength Tylenol, the headache went away but within an hour I had a bad reaction. My whole body turned red, bumps, itchy. It was bad. It was bizarre because I've never had reaction to Tylenol prior. I never had that before yesterday. It was the first time. They gave me a shot of steroids. The doctor didn't know if it was a bad reaction to the Pfizer reaction (said it would usually occur within 4 hours of getting the vaccine) or the mix of the Tylenol and the pfizer vaccine together. He had no clue. But he had not seen a reaction of the vaccine at 5 days later. He said I could have reacted late, or the Tylenol and Pfizer vaccine together had a bad reaction. I had covid late Jan of this year. The vaccine more interaction due to that if I had immunity to it. It was so bad I don't know if it's possible to wait 2 months for the 2nd shot. I heard the first dose 80-90 percent immunity or even more. With my body I never had this reaction. Today I'm a whole lot better (day 6). I am too putting too much, should I wait 90 days other say 4 weeks. What to do about the 2nd dose? How about using antihistamines during/after my second dose? What about Tylenol or Ibuprofen?" Caller wanted to know if his reactions could be due to him having covid before and if it was safe to get the covid vaccine after having covid infection. Response: Spoke from EUA PI (Revised: 06 April 2021) CLINICAL TRIAL RESULTS AND SUPPORTING DATA FOR EUA The study excluded participants who were immunocompromised and those who had previous clinical or microbiological diagnosis of COVID-19. Spoke from attached document and emailed as requested. My whole body turned red, bumps, itchy. It was bad. It was bizarre because I've never had reaction to Tylenol prior. I never had that before yesterday. It was the first time. Follow-up #01 (23Apr2021): This is a follow-up spontaneous report received from a contactable reporter( patient). This male consumer (patient) reported that: Narrative case summary and further information: Patient Ethnicity: # Is the patient also the reporter? Yes Reporter type: Consumer or other non health professional Specify Consumer or other non health professional: self Dates for massive severe headache: (From: Unspecified To: Unspecified) Reporter seriousness for massive severe headache: Unspecified Dates for had chills: (From: Unspecified To: Unspecified) Reporter seriousness for had chills: Unspecified Dates for nausea: (From: Unspecified To: Unspecified) Reporter seriousness for nausea: Unspecified Dates for little bit of a stomach ache and nausea: (From: Unspecified To: Unspecified) Reporter seriousness for little bit of a stomach ache and nausea: Unspecified Is Pfizer Vaccine a Pfizer product? Yes Pfizer Vaccine manufacturer: Unspecified Dates for Pfizer Vaccine: (Start: 17 Apr 2021 Stop: Unspecified) NDC number of Pfizer Vaccine: Unknown Expiry Date of Pfizer Vaccine: Unknown Why was the patient taking Pfizer Vaccine (Verbatim): just to get vaccinated for covid Other Products: No Patient History: No Investigation Assessment: No Additional Context: Caller states he is calling about the Pfizer Vaccine and has a couple of questions in his experience with this; states he had the 1st dose of the Pfizer Vaccine on 17Apr2021 and had a really severe reaction with it and basically through the next day he had normal things that are normal but the last 5 days he has had a massive severe headache and overnight had chills then his symptom was nausea and headache and everything else; states the following four days after that he had a little bit of a stomach ache and nausea which were not as bad but had a severe headache. States he had a severe body reaction on Thursday 22Apr2021 and today he is 100 percent better. HCP information: Caller declined to provide the HCP information as he does not have that with him at this time. States he took Tylenol yesterday and the whole week which is Tylenol Extra Strength 500mg and yesterday took two tablets and on the 2nd day Sunday 18Apr2021 he took about 5 tablets the whole day and the bottle has expiry date 2024 and lot ABC207. States the emergency room gave him a steroid shot he can't find the name of and has no dosage, lot number to provide. States the emergency room gave him a medication Prednisone that he is to take for the next 5 days and is required to take it this week and it is 5mg in an orange pharmacy bottle with no lot or expiry date because it is an orange pharmacy bottle. States he took Ibuprofen 200mg with expiry date Dec2022 and lot WJ02713. States the Tylenol and Ibuprofen were the two ones that were recommended to take and he took them and the Tylenol and Ibuprofen gave him a severe headache and it was really really bad on the 5th day which was yesterday and the pressure from the headache he could feel and it was a slight pressure and was uncomfortable and the left side of his body and his eyes were numb and the left arm was numb; states after that the next day on the 5th day, he had a tight pressure in his head and in late afternoon the pain was starting to get tighter with a severe headache; states today is the 6th day. Caller states he took Tylenol again and a half hour later he had a severe body rash all over his body and had to go to the emergency room to get a steroid shot from it and the rash is not ongoing and he went to the ER yesterday and they have him the steroid shot at that time and a medication to take for the next 5 days which caller said is the Prednisone. States he had the really bad rash all over his body and it was really really red and itchy and he had bumps coming up so went to the emergency room and they could not tell if it was due to the Tylenol or part of the Pfizer Vaccine; states he had taken Tylenol a couple of times in 5 days and was fine and then took Tylenol yesterday and had the severe reaction. States he had been reading a lot and is really worried about taking the 2nd dose of the Pfizer vaccine and is debating on waiting two months before getting the 2nd one and his general practitioner can't find anything wrong and can't say the reported event is due to the Pfizer Vaccine; states a lot of people get a reaction in 6 days he has found in his reading; states his HCP has some patients that had reactions within 4 hours and not in 5 days after the vaccine and states he has no patient information or lot numbers for their vaccines to report. States he had covid in late January 2021 and that can react a lot with the Pfizer Vaccine and he understands that and does not know if this is actually an allergy of the vaccine in these few days of the last 7 days or if is the Tylenol reacting with the vaccine. States he realized that having had covid in late January could affect him a lot more with the vaccine. Caller states he only has the medication for Prednisone that he was given to take for the reaction from yesterday. VACCINE SUPPLEMENTAL FORM Patient Age at Time of Vaccination in Years: 33 Vaccine Lot Number: EW0162 Time the Vaccination Was Given: 10:35am Vaccine Lot Expire Date: unknown Anatomical Location of Administration of Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect: left arm History of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect: This was the 1st dose of the Pfizer vaccine administered on 17Apr2021. Additional Vaccines Administered on Same Date of the Pfizer Suspect: None Did any AE(s) require a visit to ER or MD office?: Yes, emergency room but not the HCP office. If the patient was hospitalized, how many days was the hospital stay?: n/a Prior Vaccinations (within 4 weeks): None Patient's Medical History: see additional context Family Medical History Relevant to AE(s): None Relevant Tests: None PSCC Communication: PC filed. Caller was provided with the report reference number, contact information and hours of operation for Covid Line, # option #3, Monday to Friday 8:00am to 8:00pm EST and Saturday and Sunday 9:00am to 3:00pm EST; caller was placed on hold; due to larger than normal call volumes, the caller agreed to be placed into the queue for the next available agent. Is there a Product Complaint: Yes Description of Product Complaint: Description of complaint: Vaccine Supplemental Form completed in additional context. Caller states he is calling about the Pfizer Vaccine; states he had the 1st dose of the Pfizer Vaccine and had a really severe reaction with it;States he realized that having had covid in late January could affect him a lot more with the vaccine. States he had covid in late January 2021 and that can react a lot with the Pfizer Vaccine and he understands that and does not know if this is actually an allergy of the vaccine in these few days of the last 7 days or if is the Tylenol reacting with the vaccine.States the Tylenol and Ibuprofen were the two ones that were recommended to take and he took them and the Tylenol and Ibuprofen gave him a severe headache and it was really really bad on the 5th day which was yesterday and the pressure from the headache he could feel and it was a slight pressure and was uncomfortable and the left side of his body and his eyes were numb and the left arm was numb; states after that the next day on the 5th day, he had a tight pressure in his head and in late afternoon the pain was starting to get tighter with a severe headache.States he took Tylenol yesterday and the whole week which is Tylenol Extra Strength 500mg and yesterday took two tablets and on the 2nd day Sunday 18Apr2021 he took about 5 tablets the whole day and the bottle has expiry date 2024 and lot ABC207. States he took Ibuprofen 200mg with expiry date Dec2022 and lot WJ02713. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained. This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non hcp. A male patient of an unspecified age received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 17Apr2021 10:35 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0162) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation . The patient medical history was not reported. Concomitant medication(s) included paracetamol (TYLENOL) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. The patient experienced chills (chills) (medically significant) on 18Apr2021 with outcome of unknown , flu symptoms (influenza) (medically significant) on 18Apr2021 with outcome of unknown , severe headaches (headache) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , strong pain in my head, my left arm and left eye (pain in extremity) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , strong pain in my head, my left arm and left eye (eye pain) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , light pressure during the morning in my head not as severe as the other days (head discomfort) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , whole body turned red (erythema) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , bumps (swelling) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , itchy (pruritus) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , nausea (nausea) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , stomach ache (abdominal pain upper) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , eyes were numb (hypoaesthesia eye) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , left arm was numb (hypoaesthesia) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown , rash all over his body (rash) (medically significant) on an unspecified date with outcome of unknown. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included sars-cov-2 test: positive on Jan2021 . The action taken in response to the event(s) for bnt162b2 was not applicable. Patient's physician's impression is that he has a subdeltoid bursitis which was temporally associated to the COVID-19 vaccination. (SIRVA)

A 34-year-old male patient received the first dose bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Batch/lot number: EK9321), via an unspecified route of administration on 06Jan2021 at 08:00 at single dose in left arm for covid-19 immunization. There were no medical history or concomitant medications. The patient experienced injection site was very sore, arm swelling, and fatigue on 06Jan2021 at 08:00. The patient did not receive treatment for the events. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination, and the patient had not been tested for COVID-19 since vaccination. The outcome of the events was resolving.

A 34-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; Lot Number EL0140), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 08Jan2021 08:00 AM (at the age of 34 years) as a single dose for Covid-19 immunization. The patient's medical history was not reported. The patient did not have any allergies to medications, food, or other products. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. There were no concomitant medications. The patient did not receive any other vaccine within 4 weeks prior to the vaccine. Historical Vaccine included the first dose of BNT162B2 on 18Dec2020 11:45 AM (at the age of 34 years) in the left arm for Covid-19 immunization (Lot Number EL0140). On 08Jan2021 11:00 AM the patient experienced injection site pain, general malaise, sleepy, chest tightness. The patient was treated for the injection site pain, general malaise, sleepy, chest tightness with acetaminophen (Manufacturer Unknown) 500mg oral every 6 hours. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the events, injection site pain, general malaise, sleepy, chest tightness, was recovering.

Close
1. Dizziness - Resolved within several hours 2. Injection site reaction - Resolved within 48 hours 3. Neuropsychiatric side effects - Began within about 12 hours from vaccination. Lack of concentration proceeded by vivid dreams overnight. Then began to feel mood disturbance the following morning with profound anxiety and depression as well as continued difficulty concentrating. Depression continued to worsen to the point of crying at the end of the night of 1/25. Vivid dreams continued overnight but today, 1/26, mood disturbance has resolved and back to baseline overall except for mild headache similar to a hangover. No past medical history of anxiety or depression.

Woke up on 29 Jan 2021 with rash to right and left hands, extending fro wrists to thumbs and index fingers. No itching, no pain, no warmth. Skin red, raised. Started on Triamcinolone cream, continue zyrtec 10mg, and motrin 800mg PRN.

34 2021-02-17 vaccination site pain joint/muscle ache on left arm (site of injection); joint/muscle ache on left arm (site of injection)... Read more
Close
joint/muscle ache on left arm (site of injection); joint/muscle ache on left arm (site of injection); joint/muscle ache on left arm (site of injection); Swelling of left arm and left armpit (possibly lymph node swelling); Swelling of left arm and left armpit (possibly lymph node swelling); Unable to lift left arm past shoulder; mild fever; full body ache/pain; slight disorientation when standing; headache; fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 34-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE lot/batch number and expiration date not reported) via an unspecified route of administration on the left arm on 27Jan2021 17:45 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included latex allergy. Concomitant medication included influenza vaccine (TRIVALENT INFLUENZA VACCINE) on 11Jan2021. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162B2 on 06Jan2021 for COVID-19 immunisation (first dose at 05:45 PM, left arm). First symptom: headache/fatigue at 3:30 pm on 28Jan2021, sleep at 11 pm. Woke up at 8 am 29Jan2021, symptoms include mild fever (temperature not taken), severe headache, full body ache/pain, slight disorientation when standing. Symptoms alleviated by taking 1 acetaminophen (TYLENOL) pill (extra strength). Symptoms returned at 4 pm, another Tylenol pill taken to relieve symptoms. On 30Jan2021, mild symptoms in the morning including headache, joint/muscle ache on left arm (site of injection). Treated with Tylenol. Swelling of left arm and left armpit (possibly lymph node swelling). Unable to lift left arm past shoulder. On 31Jan2021, persisting mild headache and left arm aches, now able to lift left arm past shoulder, but with some discomfort. Treat with Tylenol. On 01Feb2021, mild headache still persisting, significantly reduced swelling of left arm/armpit. Full motion with left arm without discomfort. Treat with Tylenol. Events were reported as non-serious; did not result in death, was not life-threatening, did not cause/prolonged hospitalization, was not disabling/incapacitating and did not cause congenital anomaly/birth defect. The facility where the vaccine was administered was in a Public Health Clinic/Veterans Administration facility. There were no other medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Outcome of the event swelling arm was unknown while recovering for the other events. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Patient feeling hot, flushed, diaphoresis, dry throat 15 minutes after vaccine; denies shortness of breath, rash, hives. BP 150/100, pulse 104; notes higher than normal although doesn't know normal. Given water, monitored. Continued with BP same; pulse down in high 80s, low 90s; bit better. Refused ED monitored. Monitored for another 15 minutes or so. Ambulated without lightheadedness; BP down to 140/90, pulse 90s. Felt about "80%"; stable; ready to go home. Lives with wife/children. Knows if not feeling well, seek medical attention.
34 2021-02-22 injection site pain Patient received second dose of Pfizer vaccine at 5pm on 2/18/21 and experienced expected symptoms o... Read more
Close
Patient received second dose of Pfizer vaccine at 5pm on 2/18/21 and experienced expected symptoms of fatigue, injection site pain and minor body aches. Patient began to experience difficulty breathing on the morning 2/20, at that time the patient attributed it to asthma. Patient reports that he has not had an acute asthmatic episode in 25 years and has not experienced any respiratory condion like this before. Shortness of breath, chest pain and dizziness increased in the day to follow. On Monday 2/22 at 8:30am patient was seen at family medical facility by Doctor presenting with a 02 SAT of 93%. Covid test was preformed and was negative. Dr prescribed a preventative inhaler and some prednisone and sent patient home. Patient continued to decompensate and at 6pm was seen by previously treating physician, presenting with 02 sat of 91% given a nebulizer and sent home. Patients condition worsened overnight and he was seen in the faility Urgent care at 9am on 2/23. Patient was given a repeat covid test, that was negative , flu test that was negative, and chest xrays that were clear.
34 2021-02-28 itchy skin, rash At onset, rash covering upper portion of chest, mildly itchy. Over the following approximately 48 ho... Read more
Close
At onset, rash covering upper portion of chest, mildly itchy. Over the following approximately 48 hours, the rash spread progressively down torso to waist. After reaching waist on front of body, it continued at top of back and moved down progressively to shoulder blades. When it reached this point, it was still present everywhere it had already appeared. After the approximately 48 hours of spreading, it retreated in the reverse progression over the course of about 72 hours. So it gradually cleared on the back, then cleared on front of torso starting at waist and cleared gradually moving up the torso. No medication was taken at any time to treat the rash or any other condition/illness. Waited until 2nd vaccine dose to ask vaccine clinic if I could treat it if it reoccurs. They suggested Benadryl unless it becomes more serious than what was described to them.

34 2021-03-11 injection site pain Left arm was incapacitated for nearly a week after the initial injection. Arm could not be lifted mo... Read more
Close
Left arm was incapacitated for nearly a week after the initial injection. Arm could not be lifted more than a few inches away from torso, and pain felt like severe deep cramping constantly. No bruising or mark at the site of the injection just severe muscle pain that affected all movement and sleep. After one week I regained more mobility but still had severe pain in the shoulder muscles around injection site. At the 3 week mark I have more mobility but still struggle with a full range of motion and lifting anything more than a few pounds.

T- 98.6, R- 16, patient given water and he is drinking currently, at 449p VS rechecked, BP - 131/96, P- 82, O2- 94, R- 20, T- 97.7, 5pm BP- 133/94, P- 81, R- 20, O2- 97%, T- 97.8, 515p, BP- 128/ 94, P- 77, R- 19, T- 98.2, O2- 98% patient reports feeling better and continues in observation. 34 2021-03-22 itchy skin, pain of skin I started noticing itching a week after the vaccine. I had painful lesions on my armpit, on my back ... Read more
Close
I started noticing itching a week after the vaccine. I had painful lesions on my armpit, on my back underneath my shoulder blade and on my buttock. The lesions were very painful. I was diagnosed with Shingles two weeks after the first dose of the vaccine. I had to delay the second dose because I was taking the medicine for the Shingles. The Shingles cleared up a week after I started the medication. I was also exposed to Covid-19 during that time but tested negative. I also have a lingering achy feeling in the back of my throat over the last couple of months. It is an uncomfortable feeling.

34 2021-03-24 vaccination site pain Almost immediately after I received my dose, I felt very dizzy and began sweating profusely. My visi... Read more
Close
Almost immediately after I received my dose, I felt very dizzy and began sweating profusely. My vision became very blurry, and I had trouble breathing. No one came to check and see if I was ok. They just waved me out of the building, being terrified of what was going on and what wanting to leave the facility I drove out into the parking lot for the additional assessment. In the parking lot, I continued panting and sweating, feeling as though I was going to vomit. Again, no one checked on me, and I was too incapacitated to "honk my horn 3 times." After the additional 15 minutes, they waved everyone through to leave, so I left. There was no professional around to speak with at this point anyways. Covered in sweat and dizzy. I drove home to go to bed. When I got home about 10 minutes later, my arm where I received the vaccine was already very sore. I laid in bed and fell asleep and continued sleeping off and on for the rest of the day and night. My shoulder was still sore the following morning when I woke up. As the day progressed my fatigue increased (Sunday was not too bad.) Monday (3.22.21) I felt terrible, (headache, brain-fog, bad back pain, bad knee pain, bad hip pain.) My symptoms have persisted all week. I am unsure as to what to do. I do not have a doctor that I regular see. I am afraid to receive another dose and have even worse reactions/side-effects

Close
On 1/1/2020, I developed a rash on my palms that was pruritic. On 1/2/2020, the rash progressed to involve the soles of my feet, hard palate, and the rest of my body. The rash is papular and pruritic and has continued until 1/4/2020 without improvement. No associated fever or systemic symptoms. My daughter did have a febrile illness 2 days prior to the development of my rash.

35 2021-01-04 shingles, skin swelling, rash, redness Employee got COVID vaccine to right arm 12/21/2020. He noticed a rash to his right arm on the night ... Read more
Close
Employee got COVID vaccine to right arm 12/21/2020. He noticed a rash to his right arm on the night of 12/27/2020. The rash was red and raised, he didn't think anything of it at the time. The rash persisted and was growing in a linear fashion and seemed to have an unusual appearance. He scheduled a telehealth visit with a Hospital Urgent Care on 12/31/2020. At this time he was diagnosed with Shingles and started on an antiviral. Multiple providers on the telehealth visit think that Shingles is a reaction to the Covid vaccine, as he is otherwise healthy and young and had recently gotten the vaccine. His symptoms are improving and he will be on antivirals for a week total. He denies other symptoms or concerns at this time.

Close
body aches; Fever; Chills; Pain at injection site; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other healthcare professional. A 35-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine, solution for injection, batch/lot: EL1284), intramuscular in the right arm on 28Dec2020 17:45 at a single dose for Covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history was none. Patient has no known allergies. Concomitant medication included paracetamol (TYLENOL), ibuprofen and multivitamins. On 29Dec2020, the patient experienced fever, chills, pain at injection site, and body aches. They all started the day after the injection and where mostly gone by the day after that. No treatment was given to the patient for the event. The outcome of the event was recovered in Dec2020. Vaccine was administered in the hospital. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Patient did not have COVID prior to vaccination. Patient has not been tested positive for COVID post vaccination.

Close
Received dose 1 of Pfizer/BioNTech vaccination @1100. At 1130 started to feel itchy and noticed a hive-like rash. He took 75mg of Benadryl PO and waited a bit, then started to feel as though he had a "lump in his throat". Denies SOB, voice changes, lip or tongue swelling, and tolerated secretions in the ED. Physical exam + for diffuse urticarial rash, predominantly trunk, neck, and scalp. Medications received - Epi 0.3mg IM @1234, Benadryl 50mg q6hr IV @ 1757, 1/8 0012, 1/8 0558, Famotidine 20mg BID @1223, 2221, Solu-medrol 40mg @ 1757, 1/8 0011, and 1/8 0558. Discharged on 1/8 from ED @ 0811 clinically improved.
35 2021-01-11 injection site pain First shot only pain at injection site, headache, muscle soreness; all expected. Second shot same a... Read more
Close
First shot only pain at injection site, headache, muscle soreness; all expected. Second shot same as above but starting 24 hours after vaccine I developed left axillary pain. Able to palpate a lymph node ~1cm. Very painful on palpation. Has not limited activity but still painful. Was difficult to fall asleep 2 nights after vaccine. Now day 2 after vaccine still hurts, maybe incrementally better but taking ibuprofen. Cannot palpate significant lymphadenopathy otherwise. No fever. I am a physician.

35 2021-01-12 injection site pain Chills and muscle fatigue starting around 10:30am 1/12. Grew more intense throughout the day and int... Read more
Close
Chills and muscle fatigue starting around 10:30am 1/12. Grew more intense throughout the day and into the night. Had a fever starting around 3pm 1/12. Stayed around 102 until it went down after 3am (I took Tylenol 8pm and 12am) Headache starting evening of 1/12. At one point started to feel a slight tightening/tickle in my chest when taking deep breaths. Overall felt sick for about 17 hours and wasn't able to work or do much beyond laying around. After getting the second dose, the only side effect at first was soreness at injection site. It was surprising that I didn't start to experience other side effects until the next day. As I type this up the next morning, I'm feeling about back to normal, though sore from the chills. Slept for almost 11 hours. Temperature back to normal, no headache this morning.

35 2021-01-13 itchy skin, redness, hives Started with tingling of the tongue and itchiness of the arms. I took 50mg of Benadryl immediately, ... Read more
Close
Started with tingling of the tongue and itchiness of the arms. I took 50mg of Benadryl immediately, but then progressed to hives all over on my, arms, trunk, eyes, ears, and scalp, and legs. Went to the emergency room in case it got worse or obstructed my breathing. In the ER continued to have itching and extreme redness of my arms, with some swelling of my arms as well. About an hour later the Benadryl began working and received prednisone and Pepcid. Stayed in the ER for another hour and my symptoms mostly resolved. Was prescribed 3 days of 40mg prednisone and given an epipen. Have not had issues since then.

Within 1 hour of receiving vaccine patient complained of metal taste in his mouth, palpitations, fatigue, skin pruritus and rash. He went to the emergency room and was treated with Benadryl and steroids. The following morning he continued to have skin pruritus and developed a few skin lesions. He was also fatigued and had some shortness of breath with exertion. He had Allegra in the home so he was encouraged to take it and also had been prescribed Benadryl which he could take as needed.

35 2021-01-21 injection site pain 24 hr after vaccine, I had fatigue and generalized body aches and left arm pain at site of injection... Read more
Close
24 hr after vaccine, I had fatigue and generalized body aches and left arm pain at site of injection. I took tylenol. Those stopped by the second day morning (day after vaccine). However, in the second morning ( day after vaccine) I started having pain on left side of neck and on Trapezius muscle on left shoulder blade - and had that pain for three more days. Range of motion for neck restricted for three days. All symptoms improved after four days. I took Lidocaine patch and Tylenol for neck and shoulder blade pain.
35 2021-01-21 injection site pain For Dose 1, no adverse events other than mild light-headedness and mild joint ache, which began appr... Read more
Close
For Dose 1, no adverse events other than mild light-headedness and mild joint ache, which began approximately 2 hours after injection and resolved within 24 hours; soreness at the injection site began approximately 6 to 12 hours after injection and persisted for 48 to 72 hours. For Dose 2 (1:15pm), soreness at the injection site began approximately 2 hours after injection (3pm) and was more pronounced than Dose 1. I felt onset of mild fatigue beginning approximately 3 hours post-injection (4pm). Approximately 10 hours post-injection (11pm), onset of fever, chills, muscle ache, and joint ache, was dramatic. I was unable to record my temperature, but felt the fever diminish in intensity approximately 13 hours post-injection (2am). It persisted from this time as muscle aches, joint aches, and sweating intensified throughout the night, and the onset of heart arrhythmia and mild tightness in the chest, as well as a light cough and trouble breathing became a concern. I was unable to sleep and took Tylenol approximately 15 hours post-injection (4am). I took more Tylenol in the morning at approximately 9am, by which time the fever still felt present but low-grade, the muscle and joint aches were still fairly intense, and I noticed that my axillary lymph nodes had swollen to the size of golf balls, with the larger on the same side as the injection. I then took ibuprofen around 1pm. Very mild fever, moderate sweating, cough, muscle aches, joint aches, and heart arrhythmia persisted throughout the day and into the night. All symptoms had not resolved until Friday, Day 3 post-injection.

Close
chills; injection site soreness; fever; headache; fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable consumer. A 35-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE lot number: EK4176, expiration date not reported) via an unspecified route of administration on the left arm on 12Jan2021 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included hepatitis B and patient had tested positive for Covid in May2020 and had recovered. Concomitant medications included hepatitis B experimental medicine. On 13Jan2021, the patient experienced injection site soreness, chills, fever, headache, fatigue. No treatment was received for the events. Post vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Outcome of the events was not recovered. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Moderate soreness at injection site lasting 24 hours; Moderate fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable consumer (patient) A 35-years-old male patient started to receive bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection) Lot# EH9899 on 19Jan2021 18:00 at SINGLE DOSE for Covid-19 immunization. The patient medical history was not reported. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. No Covid prior vaccination. Facility where the most recent COVID-19 vaccine was hospital. The patient experienced moderate soreness at injection site lasting 24 hours on Jan2021, moderate fatigue (12-24 hrs post injection) on Jan2021. 35 2021-02-04 redness, injection site pain, hives I had the normal symptoms of pain at injection site, headache, fatigue, chills, muscle aches. I did... Read more
Close
I had the normal symptoms of pain at injection site, headache, fatigue, chills, muscle aches. I did get a fever for a short duration. The main thing I wanted to report is that I feel my heart and blood flow had been compromised from the vaccine. The reason I say this is that I have been getting pains in my chest and the blood flow in my body just feels not right. Lastly, I do feel it affected my cognition but I hope this will resolve soon as the fatigue dissipates. I also easily get skin reactions (skin reactivity increased such as redness and I got one red bump that looks like a hive but went away the next day). Not sure, but I feel this vaccine may be a cause for a potential blood clot. I do wonder if it has any effect on the characteristics of the blood. This is so far my experience and I hope as time goes on things become better.
35 2021-02-04 hives Patient experienced hives all over the body 4 days after receiving the COVID vaccine. Patient was se... Read more
Close
Patient experienced hives all over the body 4 days after receiving the COVID vaccine. Patient was seen in dermatology clinic and was prescribed Cetirizine 20 mg BID, Famotidine 20 mg BID, hydroxyzine 25-50 mg qhs prn, provided information regarding slow taper off antihistamine regimen. Was advised to reach out if no significant improvement over the next 48 hours (so that he can work and sleep), but wouldn't expect him to be able to go off medications until at least 4-6 weeks.

35 2021-02-08 rash with redness, rash, itchy rash, rash vesicular Severe elevation of blood pressure as high as 180/100; vesicular pruritic erythematous patches in mu... Read more
Close
Severe elevation of blood pressure as high as 180/100; vesicular pruritic erythematous patches in multiple locations of my left arm, left arm pit, left upper back, left chest occurred/Blisters have opened leaving behind painful ulcers; vesicular pruritic erythematous patches in multiple locations of my left arm, left arm pit, left upper back, left chest occurred; vesicular pruritic erythematous patches in multiple locations of my left arm, left arm pit, left upper back, left chest occurred/Blisters have opened leaving behind painful ulcers; Painful ulcers; Painful ulcers; vesicular pruritic erythematous patches in multiple locations of my left arm, left arm pit, left upper back, left chest occurred/leaving behind painful ulcers; vesicular pruritic erythematous patches in multiple locations of my left arm, left arm pit, left upper back, left chest occurred/leaving behind painful ulcers; vesicular pruritic erythematous patches in multiple locations of my left arm, left arm pit, left upper back, left chest occurred/leaving behind painful ulcers; vesicular pruritic erythematous patches in multiple locations of my left arm, left arm pit, left upper back, left chest occurred/leaving behind painful ulcers; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient/reported for himself). A 35-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number: EL1283), via intramuscular on the left arm, on 21Jan2021 at 16:00 at single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient had no medical history. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine and any other medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination. The patient had no allergies to medications, food, or other products. No history of allergic reactions to any meds (medication) in the past or other vaccines in childhood. Otherwise young healthy male with no history of hypertension. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. The patient concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took first dose of BNT162B2 (Lot number: EJ1686) via intramuscular on the left arm on 30Dec2020 at 16:00 for COVID-19 immunization and experienced severe elevation of blood pressure. On 22Jan2021, at 12:00 AM, after the 2nd dose in left arm, after about 24 to 48 hours, the patient experienced vesicular pruritic erythematous patches in multiple locations of my left arm, left arm pit, left upper back, left chest occurred, peaking on day three and still remain after one week. The blisters have opened leaving behind painful ulcers. This is not a rash that disappears in a few days. It will take much longer than that to heal. No rash with the first dose. Also, with both doses, had severe elevation of blood pressure as high as 180/100 within 2 to 5 hours on 22Jan2021, requiring about 3 doses of clonidine over 7 days where bp would cycle up and down. The seriousness of the events was reported as non-serious. Since the vaccination, the patient has been not tested for COVID-19. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of events and included Benadryl, mometasone cream and clonidine. The outcome of the events was reported as recovering. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.; Sender's Comments: A causal association between BNT162B2 and the reported events cannot be excluded based on a compatible temporal relation. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to RAs, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.
35 2021-02-10 injection site redness, injection site swelling, injection site pain Local: Mild redness and swelling at injection site 12 hours after injection along with moderate pain... Read more
Close
Local: Mild redness and swelling at injection site 12 hours after injection along with moderate pain at site. Pain began to taper off 36 hours after injection but persists at mild level 69 hours after injection (current). Systemic: Mild chills, muscle, and joint aches 14 hours after injection. Mild fever, moderate chills, and moderate-severe muscle and joint aches 21 hours after injection. Moderate muscle and joint aches continued until 30 hours after injection reducing to occasional mild chills and aches 36 hours after injection persisting through 69 hours after injection (current). Slightly swollen and mildly, at times moderately, painful lymph nodes in neck and near armpit on injection side began 48 hours after injection persisting through 69 hours after injection. Treatment: occasional acetaminophen or ibuprofen (alternating) taken during onset of severe ache pain which reduced to moderate; four doses in total over the course of 24 hour period beginning 14 hours after injection. Mild, moderate, severe categories as described on CDC's reactogenicity page for the pfizer vaccine.

35 2021-02-11 hives Patient received second dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine 2/5/2021. 4 days later developed mild hiv... Read more
Close
Patient received second dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine 2/5/2021. 4 days later developed mild hives at 8 am, 11 hours later developed hives again, more severe and lasting 3 hours. Spoke with his wife. She did give him 25 mg of Benadryl and 40 mg of famotidine. This seemed to help. Advised if hives do not continue to improve with measures provided to go to urgent care for evaluation, if he should develop any symptoms of anaphylaxis - heavy tongue, difficulty breathing, throat swelling to go directly to the ER. Understanding verbalized. Chart updated to reflect potential allergy due to hives after getting the vaccine. ? Widespread hives

I had previously contracted COVID-19 in March 2020.

Close
I began experiencing soreness at injection site and pain in right arm pit approximately 6 hours after vaccination, approximately 4-5PM. Approximately 10 hours after vaccination i felt very fatigued and tired and went to bed early. Approximately 12 hours after vaccination I woke from sleep with fevers (101.8), chills, and headache. I took tylenol, fever subsided, and was able to return to sleep at approximately 4:00AM. I woke at 6:30AM with headache, dizziness, and fever (99-100). I took more tylenol and fever and headache subsided. For remainder of day temperature would start in increase, but stayed below 99, and headache would return between doses of tylenol. I slept through the night of 1/9/2021 and woke 1/10/2021 without fever or headache, although I would experience dizziness with exertion above level of walking. Today, 1/11/2021, I am not experiencing any symptoms.

36 2021-01-13 rash, vaccination site swelling Muscle pain; Dizzy; face swelling; Dry heaving; Neck swelling; hip pain, soreness, and his back and ... Read more
Close
Muscle pain; Dizzy; face swelling; Dry heaving; Neck swelling; hip pain, soreness, and his back and shoulders are sore as well, joint achiness; hip pain, soreness, and his back and shoulders are sore as well; hip pain, soreness, and his back and shoulders are sore as well.; brachial plexus origin there was a sharp stabbing pain shooting down; rash was all over his body, but mostly on his back; drowsy; injection sight swelling in his arm; he did kind of feel like something was sitting on his chest; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. This 36-year-old male consumer received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, lot number: EK9231), via an unspecified route of administration on 05Jan2021 at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included pre-existing back injury that caused neuropathy, damaged nerves, and chronic sciatica, all in 2009. There were no concomitant medications. On 05Jan2021, the consumer experienced muscle pain, joint achiness which got painful. He was dizzy. His girlfriend noticed a rash on his body. It was welted, but not itchy. His face and neck swelled up. He was dry heaving and couldn't throw up. He was given diphenhydramine hydrochloride (BENADRYL) and steroid shots in the ER. About 4.5 hours after the vaccine, the same day was when it all came on. At 8 o'clock, it got worse. The consumer had hip pain, soreness, and his back and shoulders are sore as well. He was dizzy and drowsy. At 11pm that night, his face was swollen and his neck was swollen. The rash was all over his body, but mostly on his back. He had injection sight swelling in his arm. At his brachial plexus origin there was a sharp stabbing pain shooting down his arm. It did go away. He recovered completely. That stabbing pain lasted from the 5th-6th. He has hip pain, soreness, and his back and shoulders were sore as well. They are ongoing, but improving. He has taken diphenhydramine hydrochloride (BENADRYL) and ibuprofen (MOTRIN). He has not had a fever. His neck still has a little swelling. He didn't have difficulty breathing. But he did kind of feel like something was sitting on his chest. He received a steroid. The consumer had to go to the ER visit. He was there over night from 05Jan2021 to 06Jan2021. The consumer went to get a free COVID test, and they had the vaccine available. The outcome of the event dizzy, face swelling, dry heaving, brachial plexus origin there was a sharp stabbing pain shooting down his arm was recovered on 06Jan2021. The outcome of muscle pain, neck swelling, hip pain, soreness, and his back and shoulders are sore as well, joint achiness was recovering. The outcome of other events was unknown.
